My go to flavors are the PB&J (Yeast), Creme brulee, and tres leches. However, it seems that jelly in the PB&J has chained to rasberry from blackberry. I'm not sure if this is a permanent change, but the blackberry jam was sooooo much better. Hope they bring it back. I also try to get some of their special flavors since they are only available for that month. I really like the matcha ones. This time we got the pumpkin with spiced pepitas (cake) doughnut. It was tasty but a bit sweet. I prefer the tres leche, but it was still yummy and fun to try. I've been here a few times over the years but never got to reviewing it as I'm not really a donut person, the blackout chocolate donut was good and is somewhere in between a cake texture and a donut I love the wide variety they have but not the biggest fan of their donuts. I got the Wild Blueberry one and I liked how it didn't taste artificial, that's such a plus. However, I also tried the Red Velvet that my friend got and we both found it off and it didn't really taste like red velvet. I also felt a little sick afterwards, so I don't think I would go back. There are definitely better "gourmet" donuts out there. If you're looking for a snack before you head onto the Staten Island Ferry, look no further. I got both the wild blueberry and coconut cream donuts and they were good! Nothing special, but the flavors do stick out. Fast service and decent prices, I left satisfied. Doughnut Plant gives me life. In Woody Allen's monologue in "Manhattan", he lists a variety of epicurean pleasures on what makes live worth living. The list includes Louis Armstrong, Cezanne, the crabs at Sam Wo's etc. Well, he missed "matcha doughnuts at Doughnut Plant" because I'm not sure if words can adequately describe how good they are..perhaps moans.Pricier than your momma's doughnut joint but for good reason. Made fresh with everything made in-house, even the jams for the filled doughnuts. My gateway drug to this wondrous palace of calories was the matcha cake doughnut, but I quickly found that virtually every flavor here is excellent.Cake doughnuts are moist af with all-natural dense flavor, and the yeast ones are huge with ITSSOFLUFFY fluffiness. All served in a festive atmosphere by cashiers with perpetual smiles on their faces.My abs may hate this place but my soul loves it. They say nothing tastes better than skinny feels...but really who needs that kind of negativity in their life?

I started the year at Dudleys for New Year's Day brunch. The interior is trendy and cozy and our bartender/waiter (I sat at the bar) was friendly and quick. The drinks -- matcha latte and Bellini - were on par with the rest of the neighborhood joints. I had the big brekkie which was hearty but not heavy. It didn't lead me to a food coma so it was a perfect meal to jumpstart the day. Everything tasted good but wasn't outstanding or extraordinary, so this is what I landed on after factoring in the prices and wait that is almost always required on the weekends. (Even for just one person for a bar seat, the wait was ~20 minutes!)The menu is rather typical for an Aussie-styled cafe of this sort, so if you're into that vibe and are looking for those standard brunch dishes (avo toast, healthy bowls, etc.), Dudley's got you. I got the mushroom Benedict, which came with a side salad (that was disappointing because it was just large leaves of lettuce in dressing), as well as a matcha latte (which was well-made, but not of $6 caliber!). Everything was prettily plated! Perhaps their popular fries or brunch drinks are the standout, but I wasn't super impressed. Lots of other tastier brunch options in the area (though I will say, for an Australian cafe-type choice, this may be your best bet in the neighborhood). Went on New Year's Day. The line wasn't too crazy and we waited only for 15 min. The restaurant is small with an open kitchen. They also have a cute table downstairs for bigger group. Choices were plenty with reasonable prices. My friend ordered big breakie and I ordered the Norwegian salmon with eggs. Decent size and well prepared food. A good place for weekend brunch! Came here on a Wednesday afternoon with two other friends. I had to wait around 10 minutes for a table but no wait for the seats near at the bar. I actually wanted to try their Norwegian eggs benedict but they said it was only a weekend brunch menu. That was fine, so I choose the Avocado Toast with a matcha latte. The host was pretty nice and quick however, their service was pretty shitty honestly. We ordered our food by the counter and our drinks and the barista/bartender guy completely forgot our coffee and drinks. The food took forever to come but he gave us a complementary drink since the wait was long. When our food came along, he didn't even remember our drinks so we called him out again. He gave my friend the hot chocolate in a acme cup, but he gave my matcha latte in a regular water cup. That's not fair at all because matcha latte's are suppose to come with an acme cup. Like whatever. He also forgot to give my other friend her coffee. Like, how do you mess us 2 times. It's honestly not that hard to mess up. For my avocado toast it was pretty but the TOAST was hard. I had a hard time cutting it with a knife and when I ate it, It felt like the toast was STALE. Honestly, the Avo toast is a 2/5 star rating and I don't think I would come back here for brunch/lunch. There are a lot of brunch places in Little Italy/Chinatown. NOTE TO SELF: DONT SIT OUTSIDE UNLESS IT'S SUNNY AND THERE'S NO WIND!!! The wait to sit inside was about an hour but outside was right away. So, my friend and I decided to just sit outside. It was a little chilly but we didn't want to wait an hour since we were starving. I ordered the ricotta hotcakes with banana and maple syrup, and my friend got the shrooms benedict poached eggs. The food was SO GOOD!!! The pancakes were so soft and topped with maple syrup, it was perfectly sweet. The only con was that since it was a little windy, there were a bunch of leaves flying around us and it got in our food and water. So, we just got the check and ended up leaving :( The service was great but the food was a little pricy Dropped by for brunch on a random Wednesday because the wait here for the weekends is always pretty long and was seated immediately!The big sister restaurant to Ruby's- located in LES, is more of a solid restaurant, with a bar and deli side. The menu has some resemblance to the other, and both has the Bronte Burger (which if you have not tried before, most definitely indulge and get it because you will not be disappointed.)I got the Crab Linguine (18$) - quite pricey I know for "brunch" and there were not a significant amount of crab meat in the pasta dish- but I would still get it over and over again.  My friend got the Roast Prime Beef with arugula, and we were both so impressed by the quality and cut of the roast beef.  Our server told us they roast it for over 8 hours in house - and you could most definitely taste it in the quality of the meat. Only complaint or suggestion would be to order the dressing for the salad on the side because by the middle to the end of the meal, the dish was getting too salty.Overall, still a solid brunch option and I would always return for the fries as well. This is a phenomenal place for brunch! My friends and I came here and ordered a bunch to share and our favorites (in order) are the bronte-burger, granola greek yogurt and the big breakie. Just thinking about the bronte-burger mmm.... yum. Food and service alone is five stars. But (not that there always is one), expect to wait a bit because this place has quite the following right now. And expect to be seated near shoulder to shoulder with others. Picture the waitress having to move tables just so that people can get to their seat because they couldn't pass through.Definitely top notch food, so don't let the wait or the space deter you from a great brunch. Decent neighborhood cafe with outdoor seating in the warmer months and very decent iced coffee.  The food here is pretty good but not spectacular. Perfect if you just need a bite but are not looking for anything specific.  I really enjoy their avocado toast.  Salads here are pretty good and fresh but imo not worth the price.  Prices in general here are standard for the area-which means a little overpriced-but nothing crazy.  Cool place to grab a snack and read a book, get some work done, catch up with a friend or waste a little time if you're early for an appointment. Bartender is very charismatic and nice. Nice chat. The drinks are well made. Long island ice tea made with real ice tea! Very good!! I got a chicken at the outside to go window here.  The place has curb appeal with lots of windows, but being relatively dark inside and decorated with lots of little light bulbs.The dining area is lovely.  It's sort of modern Paris bistro meets a digital micro chip - all in black with electric light impulses around.I got the half rotisserie chicken with fries, it was $11.  It was so absurdly cheap I felt guilty.   Fries were thin but kind of interestingly puffy with a coat of spice powder, crisp.   Chicken was satisfyingly plain - like something wholesome you want when you're sick.   The food was filling and of good value.   The vegetable sides looked wonderful like broccoli rabe, but I wasn't feeling healthy.   My friend says he gets the half chicken for $16 with two vegetables.   I think that would be a wonderful healthy meal on the run. Trendy LES has a little grunge and some satisfying food - and this strip of cafes on Orchard typify that.   If you eat dinner here, you can bar hop close by easily.   The take out window closes around midnight but I think the dining room is open later.Food - of good quality and value Atmosphere - young, trendy and cute.     It's really a diner in the guise of a bistro,     But you can easily pretend it's a bistro. Coffee in the day while bar at night, Dudleys is a perfect way to kick off the weekend.This was the last stop of my running journey, so I decided to take on something simple and healthy. Make sure you add the egg on top of your avocado smash, which was probably the most generous one I've ever eaten. The whole wheat bread was a bit hard to bite, yet I somehow found myself enjoyed that chewiness.Packed pretty quickly even before brunch hours normally began. Suggest to sit at the counter next to the window to enjoy the street view. Don't order for delivery. Messed up my order and purposely hung up when I called FIVE times.Never ordering again. I've been here a couple of times already, and I would still come back. Although the place is small, tables are kind of cramped, this little Australian food spot does have some banging truffle fries. I come here and always get the truffle fries, they're just that damn good. Crunchy, truffly, potatoey, these are some legit fries. Last time I came here, I ordered the burger and split the fried chicken sandwich between another friend. Everyone I bring here always agree that the truffle fries are the best main thing here. Delicious avocado toast. Seriously, delicious. My bf got the ricotta pancakes which were a pleasant surprise. Soft and moist. We arrived around 10 on a Sunday and opted to sit at the bar since there was a tiny wait to be seated. There was outdoor seating and lower level seating as well. I appreciated the airy vibe although this place is a little small. The wait staff were super friendly. Definitely would recommend for Sunday brunch. Limited seating and slightly cramped but this hipster joint was a hit! It's not the friendliest nor the tastiest but it represents LES in a way that was quiet memorable/enjoyable. I'd definitely stop by brunch again when I'm back in town. Love this place! Great food and nice stuff, but there are not that much seats for big group. Hard to have a table during lunch time! Highly recommend crispy rice salad with egg! Great service, very attentive and brunch is beautifully adorned, filled with freshness and tastiness.I've been here over the past few years but what sparked me to write a review was when we came early this past Saturday (before 10am) and my friend had a small window to eat before she left town. I called in and they immediately answered they could take us in. The whole wait staff was swift, attentive, and took care of things with minimal disruption. And they served us my favorite Norwegian eggs benedict with salmon (the salad made with butterhead lettuce is so simple yet fresh) and kept on refilling our coffees despite how busy it was.I grew up in this area and will continue to keep returning, and this will be my spot to bring friends when they need a good eggs benedict brunch fix. So good. The food, the people working here and the atmosphere. This was our first breakfast in NYC and it was perfect. At first we were not that happy as we had to sit at the bar and as an introvert that's my nightmare, but it turned out good. The guy behind the bar was super nice and friendly. The food came out very fast and was delicious. My sister had the Ricotta Hotcakes and I had the Avocado on multi grain. I also had one of their housemade Sodas, which was very refreshing and not overly sweet. My Espresso was also very good. My sister loved the Hotcakes and her Cappuccino.When I'm back in NYC, I'll surely return to Dudleys. Nothing special. The wait is annoying, the service was below average, and the food was just okay. Trust the Aussies to serve up some amazing Sunday brunch.A very cute brunch spot and all-day cafe in Lower East Side with big, open street-facing windows. It's small so be prepared to wait if your party is larger than 2 people. The restaurant was lively and relaxed and I loved the waiters' matching beachy outfits. Prices were very reasonable, and staff were warm and friendly. My friend and I shared a Big Breakie, a classic English breakfast - two eggs and toast, bacon, mushroom, baked beans, tomatoes and a hash brown. The mushrooms and bakes beans were herby and perfectly seasoned. There were some pretty creative cocktails and beverages on the menu too. We went for iced matcha latte and basil watermelon juice. Both were very refreshing on a hot summer day.The real winner of our meal were the banana pancakes. They were so fluffy, soft and delicate. Definitely some of the best pancakes I've had in NYC and I definitely did not expect it from this cafe. It's the only dessert item on their menu so you can't miss it! (I've been comparing pictures and I think they made a different banana pancake for us - ours had ricotta (?) butter in substitute of the hazelnuts.)If you're looking for your next brunch spot, this is the place to be!

Ok, obsessed with this place!!! The food is delicious!! Came here with a friend and we were totally blown away by this place. We had lobster bisque and the lobster rolls.The soup was a perfect, and that lobster roll melted in my mouth. Great service and cute ambiance. The place is tiny and gets pretty packed so try to come before 5pm to avoid waiting. I will definitely be back! OMG!!! Food is incredible! We had the lobster roll to share with the lobster ravioli! Not a big pasta person, but this plater is to die for! Not super friendly staff at first, but after few wine glasses who cares! During a visit to New York City for a few days recently, we investigated a few more dining establishments that offered lobster rolls on their menu. Ed's was one of those we visited. We walked to Ed's, which is on the south-side of Manhattan, and the restaurant can be characterized as a cozy, neighborhood site. The interior is relatively white, a bit rustic, but definitely inviting. We sat at the bar and ordered the lobster salad, lobster bisque, and lobster roll. The lobster salad was quite tasty, notably the vinaigrette, but was a bit lacking in lobster meat. The same could be said of the lobster bisque, which was tasty, but only included a couple of small, lobster-filled ravioli. The Maine version lobster roll was quite good and fresh-tasting. The only minor tweak is that the lobster salad was placed on top of the bun rather than nestled inside of it, which can be easily corrected. The taste of the lobster roll was quite spot-on. In addition, the service was good, the staff are friendly, and I'd return there to eat and hang out anytime. Ed's does it right and I wish they were in Tucson! Sidle up to the long bar, order a lobster roll, add a glass of white wine (Languedoc Franc), gaze at the wainscoting paneling and enjoy the tunes! It's a winning combo of elements. "Hearts afire" by Earth, Wind and Fire was playing the last time we were there and the combo of the smooth yacht rock and delicious, buttery lobster roll, crisp white wine was heaven. There's no nonsense waiting (at least not when I've ever been there) - staff is so good at being efficient, friendly but not annoying and food is quick and delicious every time. I've never been able to order anything other than the lobster roll, but the menu looks pretty great if you're feeling adventurous and want to try something like a lobster BLT, lobster ravioli or lobster burger. I say if it's not broke, why fix it? Clam chowder in my opinion, is the best soup to warm you up and bring you joy during the cold New Yorkwinter nights. The one served at Ed's Lobster Bar is hearty and delicious and if you couple it with the Lobster Mac N Cheese you are sure to be in heaven. Of course there was no way I'd visit withouttrying the Lobster Roll! The bun was hot and sweet which made it hard for me becauseIdidn't know ifI wanted to eat out the large lobster chunks and save the bun for last! Decent.  Typical, lousy, unfriendly NY service.  Ignore them.  The food is better than they are.  Take care of the poor service by tipping appropriately. Service was as cold as their clam chowder. Clam chowder had nothing but chunks of potatoes and wee bit of seafood pieces. The worst service in NYC Fantastic spot.  We had the sandwich, the soup, the whole lobster and the ravioli.   It was fantastic.  The beer in tap was a perfect pairing to the food.   Great place to sop in New York. Good, friendly, quick service. Really delicious lobster roll. It looks a bit small when it first comes, but it really is a generous along of lobster, big chunks, not too much mayo. Worth the $30. The flavor really stands out. The bun is also perfectly buttered, and the fries are fresh and crunchy. Intimate, casual, tiny, well lite, clean, good food Cocktail sauce was perfect, heavy on the horseradish:) Good jams too. It's a total 4 star experience. The clam chowder and the bisque have 5 star presentation but is only 4 star flavor. Is there a dress code up in here? I'm not sure if I'm in Manhattan or on Martha's Vineyard. If you wear Vineyard Vines you'll fit right in. We super appreciated the lobster roll. The bun was just yum as was the lobster. Finished with a bang. I love Lobster Bar! The lobster, the calamari and the creme brle was all amazing. I randomly found this place by walking by and was so impressed. I would definitely come back here. It was a priced a little high, but the food and ambience was definitely worth it. It was worth the trip for sure! Super service. Exquisite lobster bisque--just the right consistency too. Lobster Cobb-- great flavor but not enough lobster for the price. House brewed ice tea-- perfect! Fantastic meal. Lobster roll was good. Fries and drinks were good but the whole lobster and the oysters and clams were really amazing. Also the Caesar salad was one of the tastiest we've had in a while! I absolutely love Eds lobster bar. The service was great, however it was a bit busy when I went so the food came out a bit slow. I wasn't a huge fan of the baked clams appetizer but my dad loved it. As my entree I got the broiled lobster with a side of fries and cole slaw. IT WAS THE BEST LOBSTER IVE HAD IN YEARS! For dessert I had the blueberry creme brle which was amazing, creme brle is one of my favorite desserts. I'm still craving the food from here and I will definitely be back! Small, cosy, cute little gem.My to go place when in Soho and it's dinner time :)Here I had my first lobster roll and so far is the best I've ever experienced. It is indeed pricey, like Hamptons pricey. I guess your alternative though is to cook the lobster yourself though, because it's not that other lobster restaurants are so cheaper.Also the french fries are crisp, thin, perfect. Lobster bisque... I thought I was in paradise when I had it. I can't compare with any other lobster bisque but this one is solid. A couple of notes... It's served with 1-2 lobster small ravioli... I would increase the number! How about a perfect magic 3?! Tends to be on the tasty end, I would bring it down a notch.As far as service, I was always treated nicely. The staff is never pushy or on top of you, witch I appreciate. Wonderful lobster rolls!! While they will set you backs pretty penny, the flavor and serving size is totally worth it. The lobster roll was heaping with lobster and the bun it's served on is buttery, soft & slightly crisp on the outside. A+ lobster roll!It comes with fries or a salad and if you're REALLY craving it, they can also give you some very tasty cole slaw. If you like Fish shack type seafood and Lobster Rolls this is the place. The Lobster Roll is expensive  $30. It comes with French Fries and a small salad. You will get a decent size roll with big chunks of lobster. It's also served only one way plain with a little butter. I found it to be a touch under season. Same with the New England Clam Chowder. Just a little under season. The Fries are very good. They're nicely fried. Can you really go wrong with a lobster roll? Yep, by drudging it in mayonnaise. This lobster roll let the lobster speak for itself, with limited (any?) mayo and a few chives. The lobster sat on a warm, buttery roll. Served with fries, pickles, and a side salad. My partner ordered the fish and chips and felt they were average...but honestly who orders fish when you can have lobster? Really nice restaurant with good service. I just happened to pass by here, and decided on the lobster ravioli. The sauce was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The bar seating is super convenient, but they also have tables. Everyone was very friendly and it was clean. I did not expect to have such an amazing meal. Thanks! Pricey and not worth it. I came here with a last minute tinder date and we ordered the lobster roll with salad and the lobster ravioli with chunks of mushroom because I wanted to try it both. Was this a good choice? This joint was packed even though we went near closing. The service speed was still decent.I was so excited for the lobster ravioli and that was the most disappointing part. There was an abundant amount of sauce but there was barely any taste to it. Their choice of mushrooms was odd and I'm not even sure why there were mushrooms. It seems like they just added that randomly. As for the lobster roll, they seemed so generous on the amount of lobster but it was also lacking flavor.

Came here once while walking around. Saw that one of my friends came here before and said it was good. Plus my boyfriend and I both love eggs, so we stopped by during lunch.We were both in love with the dishes we ordered. The flavors were spot on, not too salty, not bland at all, just the right amount of seasonings that brings out the flavors of the dish.Wanted to go back again, but they were closed because of an event, but we will definitely be stopping by again in the near future. #OVERRATED...save your $$, don't come here. The food here is average. I'm surprised with all of the 5 star reviews because the food was so basic and average that you can basically make it on your own. The bread to the sandwich also seemed like it was bought from a shitty supermarket like Shoprite. Stiff and maybe expired? The people here seem like they hate their life too. When walking in, the girl at the bartender glared at me. She brought over my drink with a resting bitch face. Really confused.The male waiter barely checked up on our table. He took our order and then gave us our check. where were you in the in-between? SMH Had about an hour wait on a Sunday for brunch for 4 people. They don't take phone numbers so you have to time it right if you don't want to wait around for the whole time. The place is very small and cozy (maybe a bit cramped). I had the sausage egg and cheese sandwich with homemade biscuits - the sausage was delicious but overall the dish was a bit dry, it could use some kind of sauce. My friends got the BLT Benedict (poached eggs, bacon on brioche) the El Camino (poached egg, avocado, pulled pork, salsa), and the signature BEC. I thought the BLT was really moist and flavorful, and the other dishes had unique flavors too. Overall a nice ambiance with a simple breakfast with some cellent varieties. I wanted to eat at this place before we headed to the airport. Tiny shop, but I was able to get a seating at the counter. I ordered:- Chai French Toast($12) - dark chocolate ganache, fresh berries, Fuji apple, and maple syrup. Love the texture of the french toast. - Spandex Salad ($13) - poached egg, miso quinoa, mixed greens, avocado, pickled carrots, puffed amaranth, roasted pumpkin seed, mustard seed, goji berry, and tamari. Simply delicious and hearty. Service was so so, but the food made up for it. Would love to come back and try other things on the menu next time. I hope you give this place a try. Cheers! Cute & trendy little (physically very small tables/seating situation) breakfast/brunch/lunch place.  The menu is largely egg-based (though I'm sure you've realized this from the name).I tried the Pepper Boy in a bell pepper (as opposed to a panini roll), and enjoyed it but would have like to see more peppers aside from green bell peppers (they were chopped up in the egg mix and everything was served in a green pepper as well - also they were a bit undercooked).  2 friends had the benedict and said that it was non-traditional but very good. I really wanted the freshly squeezed watermelon juice but they were out so I tried the Turmeric Tonic (non-alcoholic, tastes like a lemonade with turmeric and sprinkled with cracked black pepper - more on the sweet side).  Awesome playlist which reminded me of my Seattle college jams (Pains of Being Pure at Heart, Death Cab for Cutie, etc.). Had to wait 30-40 minutes for a group of 4 to be seated, but there's a cute and highly rated coffee shop next door if you need to kill time. Overall, not worth the hype or wait. Wasn't a huge fan of the steak and eggs- surprisingly too acidic and really spicy! The avo and eggs was underwhelming. I wish the bread was thicker and more artisan tasting- it seemed like your run of the mill seeded whole grain from the grocery store. I did enjoy the chili oil that accompanied the dish. The biscuit side WAS ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. Possibly the best biscuit I've ever had, and I absolutely LOVED the orange marmalade it was served with. $40 for two sandwiches, a biscuit, and a tea. Not too bad at all. We went around 3pm on a Sunday and waited around 25 minutes for a table of two. The staff is friendly and atmosphere is cozy and cute, but I probably wouldn't wait again though. Came during the weekend for brunch and the wait was ridiculous for 2 people. It was over a hour wait but we got lucky because a party of 2 just left and we were seated right away. Everyone else was waiting for a larger table. The restaurant is very tiny and you have to wait outside to be called. The menu is plain and simple. I had the steak and egg ($15) which came with a sunny side up egg. I substituted the egg with a soft scramble and it was the best decision ever. Although it was an extra $2, it was the fluffiest scrambled egg I have ever had. Also had the hashbrowns for $4 and that wasn't good at all. It came with two pieces and it was hard and didn't taste good. You can save your money and skip this. It is a little pricey for just a sandwich but it is worth trying. Should definitely get the soft scramble! I had brunch here with 3 of my friends after having this place bookmarked for so long and it was so worth it!We ordered the hash browns to share and they were cooked to perfect crispness and seasoned deliciously.I ordered the spandex which not only looked super cute but also tasted amazing, was packed with flavor, and super filling, but in a light airy way rather than that gross over stuffed feeling. Portion sizes of everything were perfect and we were all extremely satisfied with our food. We also ordered the chai French toast for the table, which I was a little apprehensive about being that it's not an egg item like the egg shop specializes in but it turned out to be SO GOOD!! The chocolate was a nice, thin consistency that didn't make it feel too heavy and it wasn't overly sweet or tart either. The French toast was also a nice portion size and perfect for sharing. As for the decor, it was super cute, I loved the cozy diner feel and they had cute little eggs printed on the napkins. Even the bill comes with a cute egg post card. The service was timely and the prices were decent as well, I can't wait to come back!! This is a small cozy popular brunch place in the Chinatown/Nolita area that as you might have guessed, serves eggs as the main attraction of its entrees.The wait can be long if you don't get there early, but Cafe Integral is right next door and the hostess will walk over to call out names if you choose to wait there.  My friend and I each ordered hot tea (Harney and Sons!) to go along with our sandwiches. I ordered the B.L.T. Benedict while my friend ordered the sausage egg and cheese on a buttermilk biscuit.  My "sandwich" was an open faced sandwich and although it was good, it was quiet pricey for the portion.  The scrambled eggs here look good and I would come back again to try the other items on the menu! Wow let's talk about avocado toast.  I've tried it just about everywhere you could imagine but this particular toast was just spectacular.  Heirloom yellow and green tomatoes, seedy bread, poached eggs - what more could you ask for?  It's quite small in here so try and find a time that's not so popular - 2:00 on a Friday afternoon was perfect for me.  It's cozy, inviting and such a sweet little spot.  It's definitely worth every penny! Great food, but relatively pricey (typical Manhattan), tiny inside, very loud, and only average service.The wait was already 30 min at 10am in the morning on a Saturday. Took forever for the hostess to put our names down on the list. Inside is cute and chic, but very tiny (there is in fact a tiny bathroom, much to my surprise I don't know how they fit it in there). Inside service was good, the food came relatively fast and was delicious. I like that even the regular tap water they give you a small pitcher with lemon and mint. Because it's so tiny inside, it's pretty loud, and while it's a cute date spot it is impossible to hear yourself think in there.We ordered the Pepper Boy sandwich ($13) and the Hot Chix sandwich ($14) - both delicious. Very filling, we didn't even need sides or appetizers. Would definitely consider coming here again, if it wasn't so ridiculously crowded on the weekend. Came here on a cold winter day. Irregardless of weather, brunch lines are always long. I remember squeezing in the makeshift vestibule with my boyfriend, impatiently waiting to be sat to a) satiate our hunger and b) be able to have feeling in our hands again.Came here because I love eggs. Obviously. And because this place is aesthetic AF. Would I come back? Potentially. The menu was overpriced (welcome to brunch in NY) but the food wasn't REMARKABLE. I wish I remember what I got but it was pretty good. I would definitely give this place another try. Gimmee all the huevos! Okay don't get me wrong, this place is cute as can be. I am also a sucker for "fancy water." I'm not a fancy gal but I loved the cucumber lemon water they bring to the table. However, I feel like Egg Shop is a bit lacking food wise.We had the brunchkins (donut holes), an egg scrambler, and the avo and egg sandwich (basically toast).Everything needed salt and hot sauce. Plus $3 to add avocado...what??? The bacon bread pudding brunchkins were dry and tasted burnt. I LOVE sweets and I ate half of one. So that's saying a lot. Lastly, service was slow and kind of weird. Our waitress kept disappearing and the bus boy seemed peeved that we didn't eat the brunchkins. However, I would come back for an egg sandwich. I heard the biscuits are craze amaze too. Hoping to come back and redo this review. I enjoy, I enjoy, I enjoy dem eggs!! I knew that I would enjoy this place, because of the name alone. I got the Everything to Me and it was so good!! They didn't have unlimited drinks, but the drink we did have was pretty good. It was the Watermelon Margarita, unfortunately, don't have frozen margaritas at this location. They have it at the Williamsburg location. The things that I wish did happen: Not waiting outside for an hour and 15 mins (it was very hot that day) and we couldn't walk around, so we had to stay. It was a pretty small place, so we had to deal with it the best we could. I am giving it a 4/5 because of the service and the food. The waiter that we had was super sweet and I really enjoyed the meal that I got. If I were you, I would ask the size of the meal. My friend got Avo & Egg and it was pretty small, she also got hashbrowns as well. And it is pretty pricey, so I would check out which meal can give you more than less. I would definitely go back!! After hearing much hype I decided to finally check out the EggShop! It's definitely a really cute brunch spot! The space is small and intimate, and service was timely. We came during lunch (about 1pm) and the wait was around 20 min. I had the BLT and my boyfriend had the steak sandwich. I really liked my BLT, finished it off to the last bite. The steak & eggs (it was a sandwich) was also tasty, seemed a little small though. I also order the grapefruit juice, which was delicious and prob my favorite part about the meal. In all honesty though, yes the food was good but I don't think it was worth the price or all the hype. The restaurant itself was very pretty and picture perfect, which is were most of the hype comes from I believe. Overall- EggShop was nice and I'm happy I went once. But I don't think I will recommend or come back. There are a ton of better brunch places around the city. What a great way to end 2017!I've been to the Egg Shop before, but two years ago and I remember it being pretty good. My boyfriend has never been and had wanted to try it for awhile so we decided to brave the cold and come here NYE for brunch. We both ordered a coffee with almond milk (they charged us each $1 more for almond milk which I thought was a little much, I can buy a whole carton of almond milk at trader joes with $2...this is where the 1 star off is for)I ordered the chai french toast, it came with blueberries, apples and chocolate. The french toast was soft and buttery. It was delicious however I didn't really taste any chai flavors.My boyfriend got the BLT eggs Benedict. It was on a piece of brioche toast. The bacon was maple bacon and there was this delicious creamy  sauce on top. I recommend both of the dishes we got. I thought they were delicious. The wait wasn't too bad either, we waited for about 20 mins (we arrived at 12pm). I also do not suggest coming here with a large group it takes a lot longer to get seated. Most people were coming as a group of 2 or 3. This is a very small restaurant! Arrived at this cute brunch spot and waited about 30 minutes for a table for 3. What does one order at a restaurant called egg shop? I debated between their chicken sandwich and an egg sandwich and decided to go with the obvious choice. I ended up creating my own sandwich (scrambled eggs, avocado, bacon and chimichurri sauce in between their homemade biscuit). My sandwich was pretty hard to eat since the biscuit kept falling apart. If I ever come back, I would get it on a panini instead or probably just get their chicken sandwich. Overall, my breakfast sandwich was just okay. It was a bit bland so I had to drench it with hot sauce, which is conveniently provided on the table.We also ordered two pieces of fried chicken ($7 each, kind of pricey) and a order of hash browns ($4 for 2 pieces) to share amongst our table. The two pieces of fried chicken were inconsistent. One was noticeably bigger than the other piece and also more burnt. However, the fried chicken was my favorite part of the meal. It was both dark meat pieces, boneless and super juicy! Not really sure how this place is so highly ranked. There wasn't a single dish our table ordered that we enjoyed or that was cooked properly. The BLT Benedict? They hadn't let the excess water off the egg and so there was water on the toast making the sandwich all soggy. The eggs in an omelette we ordered was cooked to mush and we could barely take two bites of it. The spandex was decent but bland and not worth $13. For a place with the word egg in the name you'd think they'd know how to cook eggs properly Let me start by saying the food is excellent, but very pricey.  I am very angry because I ordered through seamless and when I went to check the status of my order (because it had been so late) Seamless said it had been delivered at 1:41PM (order had been placed at 12:48PM).  The thing is I had not yet received my order. So, I called the Egg Shop. They transferred me to the rudest woman who said, "we don't do deliveries, it was an outside source who placed the order". She was BEYOND rude.  So I contacted Seamless and each person I spoke with was equally uncooperative. Finally the delivery guy called me, he was at the wrong building somehow.  The food was good, but not worth the bad delivery service, I received my order at 2:06PM.  I do not understand the rudeness of the manager.  Really no excuse for that. There's nothing more perfect than a delicious egg sandwich for brunch.The Egg Shop B.E.C. is sooo good! Perfectly, cooked runny egg with savory bacon and cheese, all sandwiched between a warm panini roll - what more could you ask for? It's very well portioned, but had I had more room in my stomach, I definitely would have eaten two of these! I'd probably rank this egg sandwich among the top 3 egg sandwiches I've ever had in my life.We also got a the Fried Chicken side which is great for two people to share. Great crunch and moist interior - would highly recommend as an addition to your main dish.We did have to wait around 20 minutes for a table, which wasn't too bad, but we over heard that some of the larger groups had to wait around an hour.

Empanadas Mamas is a 24/7 Columbian restaurant and it's an ideal place for late night [dr]munchies. They also serve alcohol. I am coming back here for my late night hunger pangs.Service is fast and friendly. The venue can accommodate varying group sizes.Empanadas were all fresh, I ordered:Cheese and broccoli - my favorite out of what i ordered, gooey, fatty, with the taste of subtle cheese and broccoliKorean beef - nicely marinatedBBQ pulled pork - I'm not a huge fan, but I thought it was done rightViagra - this ended up being a seafood empanada. There were no pleasant after effects :( I went to their other location almost 5 years ago and I've finally returned after a late night of karaoke. This place is open 24/7, so it was perfect for late night munchies. I had the opportunity to try several empanadas ranked in the order of enjoyment. Broccoli and cheese - surprisingly my favorite of them all. Korean beef - meat is super flavor BBQ pulled pork - excellent flavor Chorizo - too dry, too much meat. needs more flavoringViagra - tasted a bit fishy.Empanadas all came fresh and I wasn't disappointed at all. This place also has gluten-free options like the corn tortillas that were just as every bit delicious! Certainly don't plan on waiting that long again to try this place again. Came here at around 5:50am, so dining in was no longer an option. BUT they so graciously let me order take-out and stay in. Big ups for that because I would've had to find somewhere to eat my empanada outside in the freezing cold if they kicked me out. Ordered the desayuno colombiano for $4.09, including tax. It was good :). Probably the first time I had an empanada, twas a good first time.Recommend the place if you're drunk and you need something to eat. Super friendly staff. Good eats. I can't help but have somewhat of a terrible feeling about a restaurant after 2 unusually rude staffed Friday nite/ sat morning attempted delivery orders that for silly reasons couldn't go through and never got delivered to me. The manager Tommy was pretty nice at attempting to resolve the issues, both times.  He offered me a credit which was impossible to use when I attempted to place an order last night.  They had told me the manager left for Turkey for a month...hmmm ok.  So finally when I called back today, he was definitely here in NYC and remedied it.  However that was after many phone calls to 2 managers uptown location bd downtown...and an email and picture of the times I called and picture of the credit in the email. However 2 times of bad service back to back does leave a bad taste in my mouth. I've been a loyal fan of their food forever and love the empanadas, oxtail sopa, chicharones, etc....I'm just not sure that having these issues, the staff probly hating me....if they are going to spit in my food from now on or not.  This is my concern and I can't be 100% certain that they won't.  I've totally worked in food service before for many years and I know that type of stuff does happen when you hate the customer. I was in the mood  for some  empanadas came to this place and was overwhelmed with all the options. I loved the creativeness with the names and they chose and pairings  for each one. I had the cheesesteak and pepperoni both decent. Also had carne sudada it was a little burnt but not bad. I would probably try this place again but just for the empanadas. My boyfriend quite literally stumbled upon this spot as we were exploring the lower east side's night life. I'm sure it helped that we were a couple drinks in, but both of us couldn't stop raving about these empanadas! The ones we got had a cornmealy crust that really blew our minds. The meat was tender and the sauce - delicious! This spot is forever bookmarked as one of our must-gos for whenever we're back in NY. Good late night drunk empanada spot. It's 24hrs which is perfect for drunken late night eats. The empanadas are super expensive compared to other places. The taste is there but it's not super authentic. They have other food options but i would stick to just ordering the empanadas.Service is always slow and bad, reason why they get 3 stars. I don't blame them tho, it's 24hrs. I wouldn't be too happy working there knowing it'll NEVER close. Lol Order the chicken empanada or the cheese! GOOD LUCK! Haven't been here in a while and was confused that they now have a new location. I thought I was going crazy! The new location is nice but it no longer caters to those who want a late night snack without waiter service. You either order to go and go or sit at a table with waiter service. Brazil- my fav. Amazing juicy beef and flavor. A must try. Chorizo-found it a bit dry. Lots of meat but def my least fav. Reggaeton- one of my go-tos only down side is sometimes the pork is dry but the teen sauce helps with that.El bandito- a recent newbie for me. Moist beef and nice mole flavorClearly times have changed but I think I will always be a fan. If it's fried and covered in dough, chances are I'm going to love it, regardless. That being said, the empanadas here are more delicious than I expected. The Hawaiian empanada is worth 5 stars all on its own. The grilled pineapple has a delicious light cinnamon aftertaste that really makes it stand out from your average empanada.I also tried the Colombian breakfast with skirt steak and I loooved the seasoning of the steak. This is not your average steak and eggs breakfast. This is hardcore deliciousness in full effect. My friend brought us here for a quick dinner because the restaurant that we wanted to eat at was closed. We had the guacamole and plantains and about 11 different kinds of empanadas. The empanadas range from 3.30-3.55 and there are all kinds of options for both the filling and empanada exterior (regular, baked, and corn). Our favorites were the brasil, shredded beef, shredded chicken, korean bbq, and mushroom. The guacamole was a decent portion but lacked acidity and flavor. Overall the empanadas were solid and there are a lot of different options. They also do free deliveries! My only issue was that I glanced over the check and noticed that they automatically added gratuity to our check without telling us and we only had 3 people for dinner. I don't know if they do that often and really hope they don't, but I only noticed because I've worked in a restaurant before and always check my receipts first. If you're craving empanadas of any variety, this is the place to go. Empanada mama has an enormous menu with choices to suit your taste. I had the Brazil, chili and beef, and shredded chicken empanadas along with the yucca chips with delicious guacamole dip. The chips were perfect for sharing among a large group - my party of three shared and we still had some left over. My favorite empanada that I tried was probably the chili and beef, although I enjoyed the exterior of the Brazil one more. I liked the spiciness of the chili and beef though. The Brazil tasted too much of olive for me, which was my fault for ordering it because it did say olive in the menu. I just didn't anticipate the flavor of them being so strong. I also tried the viagra empanada (yes that is actually the name), and I really enjoyed the flavors. The interior of the restaurant was spacious and it would be good for larger groups. When I came here around 1:30pm it was pretty empty as well. Final thoughts - Empanada Mama is a satisfying stop that has a plethora of choices to suit any taste. I would definitely come back here to try more flavors! It will definitely take a few visits to try everything that caught my eye. This is literally my favorite restaurant... but y'all take 1 hour longer than listed to deliver food i order. I understand if you deliver food 24 hours then it may not be perfect. But don't tell me it's gonna be delivered at 11:35 if it ends up being delivered at 12:35... it's actually the difference between me staying awake or going to sleep. It's mad frustrating that a restaurant i believe in so deeply consistently disappoints me with false promises. However, that Cassava empanada is legit life changing. Ok ..I've now been to this location several times for either dine in or take out. If you like empanadas- this is the place for you! I consider this style of empanada Puerto Rican. I've had Colombian empanadas but they are very different than these- they usually have a more golden color to them Normally - meat are the traditional empanada. I've seen family do cheese but this place makes it all LOLIf you like seafood- then the " Viagra" one is for you - and in my opinion THE BEST one here. "Brazil" is the more traditional empanada and is my 2nd choiceThe Reggaeton - is rice, beans and pork The spicy chicken is pretty good too.I like to try different things sometimes but it's so hard when you love the Viagra empanadas lol I've tried the jerk chicken empanadas special and was EH. Don't see myself getting it again.There are two sauces available- one is a green sauce that has a cilantro taste to it and is more mild. The other is a red picante sauce. I like both My one friend swears that she likes the food at the Hells Kitchen location better ( they re-opened it since the fire). I'm indifferent to it. I think it's the same. This was my favorite restaurant when it was in HK. I have no idea what happened but the service here is strange and abusive. Their new mantra is: You didn't order that? Too bad, you're paying for it. You ordered something else? You're paying for that, too and you can wait 40 mins and miss your movie.Recently, we were seeing a show in the area and ordered some empanadas and an entree to share. We thought it was strange they brought out the rice first, but we figured it was tapas style where they bring it out as it's ready. WRONG! the waitress told us she put in the wrong order. Ok... but can we have the food we ordered? The grey haired man says that they're busy now so, "if we still want it, it will be 40 mins." Huh? No apology, quite the contrary. We received a nasty attitude.We ask for the check and not a blessed thing was removed for our trouble. Not even the garbage rice that we didn't eat because it was ice cold! We were still hungry but couldn't eat because we had to get to the show.I will never come back here. I am offended and, actually, kind of hurt because I was a good customer of their HK location for nearly a decade before it closed. TLDR: open 24/7; good alternative to pizza for a late night snackI live dangerously close to this Empanada Mama and inevitably stop in to order empanadas to go after a night out or whenever I'm craving a snack vs. a meal. I find that two empanadas are the perfect late night snack fix. My personal favorite is the Korean beef, which has a crispy, flakey shell and is filled with savory, sweet, shredded beef and scallions.Takeout orders typically take 10 minutes or so (which can be agonizing when you're hungry after a long night out) and are called out by order number. Each empanada is wrapped and labeled individually so that there aren't any mixups if you're ordering with friends. The empanadas are served with a red sauce (which I don't like) and a green sauce (which is amazing).While the staff isn't particularly friendly (I was once chastised for sitting at an empty table that was clearly going to remain empty given how empty the restaurant was while waiting for my takeout order), the delicious empanadas and green sauce compensate for this. Empanada Mama is definitely a place to visit for after work fun or after the club eats! I ventured here for a Meet-Up group happy hour. We were seated immediately around 5:30 PM which I think is perfect timing; Any later and you'll see that it gets really packed, but luckily this place is open 24 hours.Happy hour is not that great honestly. For a place that prides itself on its empanada variety, you would expect that they would at least have some happy hour deals on them but the only thing that that is offered are drinks. BUT, let me say that the drains are extremely good! I decided to have a white sangria and after a few sips, I was tipsy. It tastes really good but its a sneaky drink. Be sure to order it, if you decide to dine. Now for the main event, the empanadas! I ordered one of each type; Empanada Mama offers wheat flour, corn flour, and oven baked empanadas. I opted for the "reggaeton",  shredded chicken, ground beef, and traditional cheese. The Reggaetn was not as spectacular as I had envisioned or hoped it to be based on the reviews, but it was decent. The shredded chicken had to be the worst I have ever had. It was extremely dry and flavorless. The ground beef and the traditional cheese were A+ on my list though. They were both made very well with a crispy shell, savory ingredients, and a great blend of seasoning. We also had an order of guacamole, which was alright, it could've used some salt-and-pepper.Service was really good. The waitress was very attentive and helpful with all of our inquiries. The same goes for the bus boys and other staff members, we had no issues. I definitely recommend  trying out this place, especially if you're in the neighborhood. It's relatively inexpensive and a good place for groups to catch up and eat. otherwise, I won't be running to return here as it wasn't that memorable. The delivery time is okay, but I need to talk about this real quick. The empanadas were pretty good - they were all varying temperature degrees. One was cold, one was lukewarm, another was decently hot. Not too sure what happened there, but I don't care about that. It's your delivery service that I take issue with.My building has no intercom so I have to go downstairs when I order delivery. When I opened the front door, I thanked the delivery guy as I usually do. But instead of just making usual conversation like others do, this guy opened the door all the way despite me just trying to get the bag, leaned forward to hug me and kiss me on the cheek. That is a solid no, especially after midnight when I'm alone downstairs. I understand if your staff is trying to be friendly, but this goes beyond that because I didn't know what was going on and I have never had this happen to me in 8 years of ordering delivery from any restaurant. Please speak with your staff about proper conduct with customers, especially since most people are uncomfortable with physical contact from strangers. I've passed by this place many times and always wanted to try the empanadas here. I was overwhelmed by the menu choices for empanadas. I did not know they offer so many different flavors and combinations! Everything in the menu sounded good. I took about 5-8 mins just looking at the menu because I couldn't decide what to get. The price is decent for empanadas. I ended up getting the BBQ pulled pork, beef, shredded pork and cheese steak. When I ordered I didn't realize they have a seasonal menu for empanadas :(. I ordered take out and it took about 10 minutes for the food to be ready. The empanadas looked small but it was pretty filling after 2. The green sauce is so good. The beef and the pork is pretty dry so you definitely needed the green sauce it hot sauce. The BBQ pork was pretty good but I would have liked it in the wheat flour. The cheese steak was good. That was the best one. The BBQ pork and cheese steak is good without the sauces. I would definitely come back here again to try the other empanadas on the menu. Only ordered 2 of the Viagra empanadas to go but they were delicious and filling. I ate here to compare the Viagra empanadas that I had at the Empanada Mama in Midtown and I'm glad to say that they're pretty similar in taste (though the ones in Midtown tasted slightly fresher).The cashier was friendly and helpful. The empanadas came out in about 5 to 10 minutes, so overall I had a great experience. Looking forward to their other flavors! Awesome service! Order quickly to go! I ordered 16 different kinds and it was ready in 10 minutes! I also got a courtesy call! They also have Viagra in a corn masa!!!! DELICIOUS!

The best gluten free cupcakes and treats!Delicious, not heavy or sugary treats that I recommend to all who are gluten free / vegan.One of my fav places to visit when I come to NY as the cupcakes are delish and priced well compared to other places in NY that offer gluten free treats. The donuts here are really really great. It's almost beside the point to say that they're gluten free and vegan. Cinnamon sugar, mocha, cookies and cream. All delicious. And the bakery itself is warm, lovely, and filled with delectable smells. I expected more. This place has so many great reviews but my experience was super underwhelming. There were plenty of choices that looked delicious: vegan cupcakes, tea cakes/loaves, and donuts. I went with the lemon blueberry scone. BIG mistake. It tasted nothing like a scone. It was a soggy mess that reminded me more of a slice of cake than a dry and crumbly scone. The icing didn't redeem it either; I could find the blueberries but I barely tasted the lemon. It felt like a waste of money and I immediately regretted not choosing something different. The bakery itself is also tiny (read: hole in the wall). There are some stools and window benches but in general, it feels a bit drab and old. It wasn't clear if they offered other items, such as coffee, because their signs weren't the best or were nonexistent. Maybe everything they make is great and I just got the one bad option. And I hope this is the case . . . but from what I tried by itself, I'm angry I even went. I ordered a chocolate cake with vanilla frosting. I called in my order and didnt meet the minimum advance notice time but the person on the phone was very nice and accomodating. The cake had a very thick consistency. Everyone enjoyed the cake. I especially liked the frosting! We found a veggan gluten free bakery in the city.  Must go check it out.   Walked in cute cozy ambiance. Lady behind the counter had no intentions in helping us.  So we just ordered what we wanted.Cran-apple bread- moist and there's actual chucks of fruits in the bread.  Very good and not too sweet.Carrot bread- moist and chucks of carrot.   Very good. Oatmeal raisin cookie- was very good but the cookie was so thin.  It fell apart itself. Overall good quality bread but service Definitely needs to be improved.  Would only go back for their bread as they have good selections of it. 3 stars is only for the bread. This place is decent. I ordered a red velvet cupcake, and it wasn't amazing but it wasn't bad either - just good. Vegan desserts are always a hit or miss for me, and I liked that they had a wide range of baked goods.This place is certified kosher so that's a plus. The bakery was very cutesy, with the decor and the music. Worth checking out! The girls that work in here are great! Super friendly and full of smiles when you walk in. Almost doesn't feel like you're in NY. ;-) My kiddo wasn't a fan of the big cranberry chunks in the jam on the cream and jam biscuit but I scraped it and then he ate it but meh he's a kid. They have a good selection of donuts, breads, biscuits, cupcakes and cakes. They are vegan, soy, but (only have coconut) and gluten free which is amazing! Prices are not bad considering they are a specialty bakery. I got about 5 different items for around $20.  If we are ever in NY we will be back! I only gave it a 4 because there is hardly any seating, no tables and I didn't see a restroom either. Which may have been tucked away in the back somewhere but that seems to be the norm out here. Erin McKenna's BabyCakes, Sugar Sweet Sunshine, and Two Little Red Hens all have that same comforting, homey nooks-and-crannies ambiance down pat. BabyCakes has the added bonus of providing many options for "gentle tummies" so all of y'all with wheat, egg, and dairy allergies can join the rest of us in pigging out. Er, I mean, cultivating your summer bodies. Admittedly, I haven't tried most of the BabyCakes menu, but I'm not sure if I would ever turn down a regular cupcake in favor of a gluten-free one, especially when I'm not averse to gluten and I've noticed that gluten-free pastries just taste a little ... different. Not bad, per se, just not the same in terms of texture. Also, I do very much appreciate that they post their nutritional and allergen info on their website. It's very cool that there are so many bean flours out there - like garbanzo and fav bean flour! I did notice that almost all of their products contain xanthan gum, which, while used in almost everything as a stabilizing agent to keep oils and whatnot from separating, may come into contact with allergens like wheat and soy during its production process. - Lemon cupcake: Not as tender as a regular cupcake but still very good. Lemon-based desserts tend to swing to either too sweet or too tart but this one managed to retain both a strong lemon flavor without any overwhelming sweetness.  - Chocolate dipped donut. I bit into this expecting the flaky, chewy layers of a regular Dunkin Donut or a Krispy Kreme but this is actually much denser. I foolishly forgot to order a drink while eating my sweets and so this sat like a brick in my stomach but almond milk would have paired great. - Double chocolate crumb. Definitely get this one. Even compared to regular cakes made with white flour and white sugar, this ranked as one of the top cakes. Chocolate in every crevice. Very similar to a brownie in terms of how dense it is (sorry for the repeated use of "dense" - I've just run out of adjectives to describe how solid the goods are). The cupcakes and cookies are a little pricey relative to their size but the cake is certainly worth your money. I'll be back if I'm ever in the LES and a craving hits for the dark chocolate crumb! Location: right at Broome street, Erion McKenna is tiny and nothing special. I mean, if you pass by, you probably gonna miss it. Place is tiny and I am surprised if you want to sit-in. Place is dark as well, but the surprising thing is that you can watch chef making bakeries.Food: it's probably the first vegan, gluten-free store in NYC. I have been longing to be here but never got a chance or passion to be here. Why, cuz I am not either vegan or gluten-free. Why, I am lactose free...JKSo They have cupcakes, bread, and donuts. Of course, I chose only one maple donut ... It was not what I want. First of all, the donut is cake donut. Maple syrup is okay tho. Overall, it is just less compatible with other donut places.Service: efficientPrice: average price is 3.5 or more.Be awared.But to be honest, I love their vegan donut better than By Chloe's bakeries...overall: 3.5 stars. This place is so cute! I really wished there baked goods was something special so I can go back but unfortunately it wasn't. I walked in to a friendly and helpful staff that helped me pick out the mocha carrot cupcake which was good and the cinnamon sugar donut which was okay I also ordered the chocolate chip banana bread which wasn't anything special. I hope the recipes improve between the location, decor and staff they can go places!! I was looking for vegan cupcakes and found the most delish ones here! Had a carrot cupcake with cinnamon frosting. Cake was moist with just the right amount of carrot and spices. Frosting was absolute vegan heaven--creamy, just the right texture and perfectly sweet. Two vegan thumbs up! Forgetting I was in a vegan bakery in Soho, I ordered a dozen doughnuts. When they guy behind the counter said "that will be $47," I had a mini heart attack, but said "okay," and handed the man my credit card, because he had already packed them up, and I don't like inconveniencing people. When I took one (then two, then three...) out at home, HOLY FUCK. SO GOOD. WORTH EVERY DOLLAR. I'm not a vegan, and I don't even really like cake doughnuts (I prefer yeast doughnuts), but these were some of the best I've ever had. I've eaten them for dinner every night this week (and not just because I basically blew my grocery budget on doughnuts). Go here. Get a doughnut. Get more doughnuts. Do it. (And don't JUST go for the pretty toppings; even the doughnuts that look boring don't taste boring.) I've been here twice and I want to love it because vegan, gluten free and sweetened with something other than refined white sugar is right up my alley but it's just ok, in my opinion. I tried the agave brownie - it was cakey and just lacked any oomph of chocolate flavor. I also tried the pumpkin bread - again, ok. I could taste the underlying (garbanzo?) flour and it wasn't really that full of pumpkin flavor. It was a little dry but not too bad. I also tried a carrot cake cupcake with vanilla frosting. The moisture level was good but again, lacked much flavor. I think they could add just a bit more spices and carrot and really bring it to the next level. The win for me is the thin mint cookie and the coconut mounds - those were the only 2 items that really stood out last time I came here too. I should have learned from my first experience and just bought those and saved some money. The selection is limited and is previously noted by others, it is small. One other thing that I would like to add is that both visits, the staff leave much to be desired. They are unfriendly and it seems like a burden to have to answer questions you may have or assist you. If I"m in the area, I would stop for a thin mint and mounds. Otherwise, not worth going out of my way to stop in. This will serve as a reminder to me next time I go to NYC and try to determine which places are worth returning to! Not a big sweets guy but it was my dads bday and I was instructed to pick up dessert. What a score to find this spot in the LES. Totally vegan and gluten free! Score!! Not sure what the negative reviews are about, this place is a winner. it can be tough to find such good vegan baked goods and felt lucky to find them. Got the donuts because they are BAKED and not FRIED like what you get at any other vegan donut places. They are not oily, so maybe that's why some people don't like here. Anyways, very delicious and come in the afternoon for full menu. Samona and mocha are so good (not overly sweet/moist like a cake)I absolutely love those bakeries even though I never like donuts or cupcakes. For me, these are usual sugar overdose and ehh. But Erin changed me. The donuts are for sample, which is light and fluffy. The cupcake I got is coconut chai- which seem to be less sweet! But it's really good! The cashier said the death by chocolate is probably the sweetest. Also got veggie biscuit - not that good. More chewy type. Cupcakes are around $5 and donuts are $4. I went there pretty late on weekend nights, not so many choices left. I love Erin McKenna's bakery.  I remember checking it out when the bakery first opened, as Babycakes.  And am happy to report that the variety of choices, the quality of each item and overall deliciousness is top notch.I have a huge sweet tooth and checked out mostly all of the bakeries in New York.  While I'm not a vegan or gluten intolerant, I am mindful of what I put into my body, and Erin McKenna's bakery always feels like a sweet indulgence that I can feel good about.  I know there are no processed ingredients, artificial colors, or weird stuff that I can't pronounce in anything they create.The texture of the products and flavor cannot be beat!  You're definitely not compromising on taste or soulful sweet goodness in coming here.I recently ordered a couple of doughnuts and chocolate chip cookie sandwich through Postmates.  All were delicious - highly recommend! Thank you Erin McKenna for having some great allergy options! :) I can't eat eggs or wheat and you guys saved my birthday. I'm really glad places like theirs exists. The shop is teeny tiny, but they have so many good options. Their donuts are soft and tasty and sweet, the scones/cream buns crumble nicely, and their cupcakes have fun icing. They had the best vegan cinnamon rolls I've every had (which were also gluten free!) - flaky and buttery with lots of cinnamon. The only thing that was off was with their chocolate cake and cupcakes - they were pretty burnt, and I think it must have been hard for them to tell because of the color. 3.5The bakery is extremely tiny and they have a very cute interior. It's quaint. You definitely feel like you're in some tiny small-town shop instead of a famous bakery in New York. There's almost no seating inside, which I think would be nice to have! I used to live nearby here, and since my boyfriend is vegan, we've been here a lot.Most of the time, the people who work there aren't too friendly/warm. It's also extremely overpriced ($4 for a tiny donut?!). However, if you're looking for vegan/gluten-free baked goods, this is a great option. They have yummy cinnamon rolls, donuts, clairs, and cupcakes. I will say it's awesome that everything is vegan - it's not easy to find many places like this! Give it a try, I would recommend going at least once to see if you like it. I've always been meaning to try this spot out. I am not a fan of dairy so the fact that this place offers vegan baked goods is a huge plus in my book. Unfortunately I have not found much luck in finding moist delicious treats that are dairy free, but I think I've hit the jackpot. I bought quite a few things just to try and found every single one of them to be soft and delicious. Especially loved the chocolate chip cookie. I tried four of their cupcakes, a donut, a scone, a brownie, a cookie, and a madeleine PUMPKIN PIE CUPCAKEBROWNIE MOCHA CUPCAKECINNAMON CARROT CUPCAKERED VELVET CUPCAKECINNAMON SUGAR DONUTBLUEBERRY LEMON SCONE BROWNIECHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE MADELEINE (which I ate on my way home- couldn't wait lol)Side note: the employees here have serious RBF, but they were generally nice. It's really hard to find a vegan bakery when you're not in NYC. Since I was in NYC I decided to try one I found on trip advisor which lead me to Erin McKennas. My expectations were neutral and I decided to order a blueberry scone and a mint brownie. I wasn't thrilled with either. The scone was meh and the mint brownie although the icing was awesome the brownie itself was like a dry chocolate cupcake there was nothing "brownie" about it. The prices were a little high but I expect that in NYC . The display was dark and you really couldn't see what was in the case and there weren't prices on anything. It was so hot inside and i was expecting a little more from a well known NYC bakery.

Let's face it, the main reason people make a weekend reservation to this place is for the bottomless brunch. In total with our entree we spent about $50/ person. This was including mimosas, bloodies, and screwdrivers. You can also interchange between these three throughout your meal if you get sick of one. The service is great they are very attentive to your glass. The mimosas are already made and they go around with pitchers and when I say you will not see the bottom of your glass I mean it. So the bottomless is definitely worth it if you are trying to get your day going. The waitress was also nice enough to get a group picture of our table and she was very happy to take it. As far as the food goes there is a good selection. Everyone was satisfied with the portion size of the meal. The food is ok but it is not amazing which is to be expected with a place like this. It gets very very crowded on weekends and the turnover is pretty quick (1.5 hours). Good place to bring a big party in LES! Never ever order the scallops from here. The last few times I came they were amazing and that's why came tonight. They Were undercooked which is extremely hard to do when you're cooking a scallop bc most ppl over cook the crap out of them and they become rubbery. These come with risotto witch was PHENOMENAL. The bartender was a sweetheart about it though. Our group of five enjoyed dinner on Saturday night.  The restaurant has a strange setup with several different dinner zones but I think this adds privacy and uniqueness to your dining experience.  The bar area can get loud so being removed from it allows you to enjoy your dinner conversations.  The dinner lighting areas are dark so you can't really see and appreciate and critique your food because you can't really see it.THe food was excellent and the staff was excellent. We did come early so we had no competition for our attention. I would strongly recommend the sliders with short ribs.  You get three and unfortunately I agreed to share them before I tasted them. The rack of lamb was served lukewarm unfortunately but was incredibly succulent. It was probably a little fatty but I couldn't really tell because of the lighting. Final adviceCome earlyGet sliders and lamb rackReasonably priced I came here for one of my friend's bottomless birthday brunches. (Say that five times fast!) and was underwhelmed. We were a party of nine and dined in the afternoon.Here's what you need to know about Essex:1. Great service. Our mimosas were always topped off (which makes it easy to lose count... so be prepared) and the servers were accommodating to our questions. 2. Vibes are typical LES NYC brunch. This spot is an institution for a reason.3. Relatively extensive menu. There are options for everyone here. Vegetarian, vegan, everyone will be happy here.4. So here is the rub: the food... is bland and overprice. I got the Southern Brunch and ended up smothering it in hot sauce, and it was still plain. AND IT WAS COLD. I didn't have the heart to make a big deal out of it, especially it was my friend's birthday. But paying about $50 for brunch and to have it be that level of quality? Not okay.While the mimosas are delicious and strong, it doesn't overcome the overpriced and less-than-mediocre food. I wouldn't come back on my own, only if someone threw a birthday party here. If you have a choice, I recommend Sons of Essex. The vibes are a little more fun and the food is significantly better. I was walking around headed to another brunch spot when I came across this place. What caught my attention was the music it was awesome it seemed like a party was going and I didn't want to be left out. We had a less than 10 min wait time which was awesome. I loved the atmosphere  and music.  It was a young vibrant hip place. I had eggs Benedict with lobster.My food was so friggin good!!  Everything was awesome only thing I wished that music wasnt so loud. Went here for a bottomless brunch with some friends for their birthday. Won't return because the food was not that good at all I guess because people mainly go for the bottomless drinks. I believe the brunch was around 35$ a head. I ordered egg-whites with fruit and potatoes. Seriously how do you mess up eggs? I guess they were just sitting all morning. Also the fruit was sour and wilted over a bed of lettuce. I sent this back and got the banana and chocolate pancakes which were actually really good and filling. The waitress was really nice and accommodated all of our requests.  The place itself is very nice inside with two levels. The decor on the wall however was very dusty lol. They also brought out a nice slice of cake for my friends birthday. I just think that there are so many nicer brunch places in the city than this one. Caveat: my only time here so far as been for a private catered event.  However, multiple people from our company who have dined at Essex on various occasions said that they bring the same level of excellence to their main dining.Decent space.  Really like how the upstairs space over looks Essex Market.  And the general location is prime!The staff were lovely.  Most of them were working our party and the entire evening shift.  But they kept it professional, personable, and even went above and beyond what was included in our package.  Excellent bartenders with some heavy hands, and really great wait staff, who truly seemed invested in the cuisine they were serving, and our enjoyment of it.  I either liked or loved the majority of the items served.  A few things were "okay...", but nothing was bad.  Highlights were the delicious crab cakes, the attention to aesthetics for the crudites, the amazing cured salmon on their lovely potato pancakes and beautiful crema, amazing fillet mignon, and the single best lobster ravioli I have ever eaten anywhere in the world (how the chef jam-packs every ravioli with that much well-seasoned, flaky lobster without the gorgeously thin pasta popping?  I do NOT know!).Already plan to return on my own dime, and would gladly pop in to chill at the bar if passing by.  Big new fan! Came here for a corporate event. We got a spacious room with food serving stations placed around. The food was always full and attentive and clean overall. Great experience. Saturday- brunch review:$17 a la carte (just entree) or $32 bottomless mimosa/ screwdriver/ Bloody Mary + entree. Refills were on point. Entree: grilled shrimp avocado salad - 5/10. Nothing special - cucumbers spinach red peppers grilled shrimp and mashed avocados. WORST PLACE EVER!!!! DO NOT GO!!!! I am at the emergency room right now and called 30 hours in advance to cancel a reservation, and the MANAGER told me he's charging me $60 for this. I asked nicely if he could wave it since I'm currently in the emergency room and he said "you bet your ass we're going to charge you". What kind of soulless person does this? I've never witnessed such bad customer service. I will make sure I spread the word to never go here. Loved  Essex. I traveled to Essex from 42nd and 9th because nothing relevant is in midtown and my tastebuds are worth the $2.95.I ordered the Aristocrat and there were no disappointments. Only qualm was that I could have had 3 eggs instead of two to even out the flavors of Nova salmon, eggs and latkes.My friend got the spinach version of eggs Benedict. We sat upstairs, Mo was our waiter and he hooked it up. I will most likely return again. I love this place. The service here is spectacular! Right when we got through the door my girlfriend and I was greeted by one of the most personable security guards I have ever encountered. He made great conversation and embraced everyone with open arms. Then after 5 mins or so we were seated. The waitress always kept our glass full, and brought the food out promptly. I recommend the chocolate banana pancakes, mmmmm delicious. You have to be seated by 4:30 if you want to participate in the brunchly activities. I recommend also making a reservation, place gets packed quickly Went for brunch, the unlimited Mamosa's was great. My tofo scramble was good. Space was limited but nice overall experience. Will attend again. Brought in the new year here at Essex; with a prefix food menu and a top shelf open bar for 3 hours it was well worth it. NYE 2018 the place was a mad house. The entire place was packed and the hostess was no where to be found at first. After finding her she pulled up my 10:30pm reservation and whisked us up to our table. The open bar package was well worth it and the waitress made sure we always had one more on the way. The champagne flowed all night, probably too much by the time it was all said and done. The food came out in a timely fashion. The oysters were fresh, the scallops were plump and the sea bass was cooked perfectly. At $135pp it seemed overpriced at first however the tasty food accompanied with strong and constant drinks coupled with great service made it well worth it. This place is just okay. It's a place to go brunch, nothing special about it. They will make sure that your glass is never empty. The food is just okay- came out 7 minutes after ordering and was barely warm. Can't say enough good things about Essex! We were very late for our resi due to insane NYC traffic, and they found a way to accommodate our party of 5! My whole table ordered something different and were all pleased! Highly recommend the Avacado toast and the Mac n Cheese! Service I as great, our drinks were always filled! Lastly the music was the ultimate playlist. I'll be back! I've been here multiple times for happy hour and it's a decent venue. The bartenders are OK, when they want to be. I think the crowd annoys them and they don't have patience.This time I was here for brunch. We had a 3:15 reservation and didn't sit down until after 4. They gave us ONE free drink ticket for the brunch drink (basically a mimosa while we waited). Once seated, or servers were great! I think they knew they'd messed up and we weren't happy. I was even able to get the yelp specialty drink. Honoring your ads are a plus! The food was very good. I needed a little more steak for an additional $4. That extra charge is unnecessary for that amount of meat. I got to taste the breakfast nachos and they were amazing. I may come back for that, unless they make me wait another 3732887401 minutes for a table. We came to have brunch for my cousin's birthday and we were a party of eight.
