I tend to be a hard critique of the taste of any cafe's black coffee, but La Colombe's coffee is soft, not too bitter, and has a wonderful aroma to it. It just goes down so smoothly. They also have this amazing cold brew/iced latte combo called the Black and Tan, which is a drink that is half cold brew and half iced latte (on tap). It's so pleasing to look at too because the latte they pull from tap is so silky and not super foamy so it sits nicely on top of the cold brew. You can either just drink it without mixing it or take the long spoon they serve it with to mix the it together before drinking it. Either way, it's refreshing and so delicious that I go back to La Colombe every time to just get this drink.I visited this location by SOHO multiple times and each time, the line was always to the door or out the door. The store itself is on the smaller end with limited seating. But the line moves quickly so you won't be waiting long for your drink. Their pastries are also delicious! A perfect pick me up after a lot of walking around. Great ambiance, so it's a nice location to meet with friends, too! The smell of coffee in there was very delightful. Pros:* Diverse customer-base, great for people watching* Surprisingly good amount of seating* Clean* Beautiful marble bar top that you can actually grab seats at* "Coffee on-tap" for those of you hipsters who are too good for drip coffee* Decent amount of space between the tables so you're not made to feel like you're sitting on your neighbor's lapCons:* Baristas. Always the baristas at places like this. I want to - for once - go to a non-chain caf and have a barista smile at me instead of being a condescending dickhole* The ambiance feels like all they care about is turnoverWould only recommend this place if you're a) in the neighborhood and b) don't plan on staying for too long. Definitely do not recommend being a regular here. Would like to consult for them to make it a more inviting "neighborhood coffee shop" but she's probably a 30-year-old former art student who wouldn't care about my "corporate " ass anyway This is my Favorite coffee place in New York. Try out the oat milk latte - it tastes like a hug in a cup. Worth the $5.50 splurge if you're needing a morning pick me up, or just want to feel cozy. Lines can get pretty long, but they handle them like a champ! This location has zero seating (I really think there is actually one tiny bench). La Colombe and I have a love-hate relationship. I dislike the lack of menu and pricing - it gives off a kind of "if you know you know, if you don't get out" kind of vibe. The prices are steep for the portions.That being said, their draft latte is out of this world. I don't know why it's so good, but it is. And it keeps me coming back. For me, it's a coffee I get once a week or so, but not my daily go-to coffee. Too many people tell me it's the most amazing coffee in the neighborhood. I don't think it was bad by any means but it was definitely not the best thing I've ever had. It was literally just coffee. I think it's overhyped, and very hipster inspired which is why it has such positive reception.

Everything is fantastic here but good luck getting a table! It's really good and everybody knows it, so it's packed. I had been here in the past a couple of times for bites.Their cocktails are fantastic. I really enjoyed El Mixteco which consists of hibiscus infused mezcal, lemon juice, agavero liqueur and agave nectar.Service is great, at the end of our group's meal, we were offered tequila shots on the house, which is always appreciated! Fantastic Happy Hour!!I came with 2 girlfriends last Monday and were lucky to snag a table "outside" under a heat lamp without a reservation. It was a warm night for January and sitting there was perfectly fine, not cold at all.The service here is great. Our waitress was more than willing to make suggestions. I had a Mayan cocktail (I could not resist corn in a cocktail) and a margarita. The Mayan was delicious but I wished I could taste more corn in it. The margarita was fantastic too. My friends both absolutely loved their Essex Crossing drink (I think that was the name. Gin & blackberry in it)We all ordered the fish tacos which were SOOOOO GOOD. A bit saucy, slightly messy but perfectly crispy fish. I had to get a second order of them. Not even slightly ashamed. Happy hour prices are great too. For 3 people who had 2 dishes and 2 cocktails each our bill was only $78. Honestly not bad for the quality of the food. Only downside is that this place is VERY small so make a reservation. I came here last night with a friend only to be greeted by a rude & condescending hostess. I arrived at 6pm and asked if I could get a table but the hostess said it was for the lady in front of me and I would be next. Knowing it was almost a full house and the only seats left were at the bar, I decided to sit at the bar instead. I sensed she wasn't too happy and gave a bit of an attitude so I figured maybe she had a bad day.My friend came 5-10 minutes later and because we were carrying so many bags, she wanted to see if we could get a table instead. The hostess said "there's someone else in front of you" which was not true because no one else came after me so ok whatever, we can sit at the bar. Then my friend asked if there was a happy hour menu but turns out we just missed it at 6pm which is fine too so my friend proceeded back to the seat at the bar.Now this was what changed it for us. The menu was open in front of us and earlier, a waiter had placed the chips and salsa on top of the menu. She walks over and lifts up the plate, rudely slams it on the table, and closes the menu. She doesn't say anything like "sorry I don't want to get the menu dirty" or smile in the process? Something at least? But whatever it is, that was very rude especially when my friend asked her questions very nicely. I personally don't like leaving a restaurant when I've already been seated and the waters/breads/chips etc. are already served. However, my friend just wanted to leave and she's right, why should we give any of our business to someone who made us feel unwelcome, and then without saying anything, we just walked out. I wanted to give this place a chance as I go by yelp all the time. Decor was nice (along with the waiter/bartender) and I could see how it could get cozy, but not with this past experience. Maybe it would've been better if we went to their other establishment in west village but I don't think it'll be anytime soon. This place lived up to their name. I was definitely content with this little restaurant. You walk in and you already feel like you're in Mexico. It has a bunch of cute artifacts and decorations that expresses halloween or day of dead. However this place is pretty small - this might just be a NY thing where all their restaurants are small. The waitress was super excited to help with our orders. She was a very cute lady who tried to help us choose our drinks. One time we kept ordering Mirosa and thought they meant mimosa but she corrected us but after awhile she kept saying mimosa too. The mirosa drink was not bad if you like something light. If you wanted something stronger you can get the Mayan. The food was on spot. I never had Huevos rancheros like this. Every bite was super flavorful. I can't compare these meals to Mexico but compared to North Carolina they made them look bad. I guess you can say I won't be going to another Mexican place in NC. Must warn you that if you are sensitive to spicy food you might want to be careful in which dishes you get. I LOVE SPICY. So this was the place for me but my friend who loves spicy but can't handle it was sweating up a storm. Honestly it wasn't that spicy but I guess we'll never know. The other reviews about terrible customer service and a condescending hostess are true. The hostess was rude, unwelcoming and acted like she was doing us a favor by putting our names down. She scowled the whole time and told us it would be about 90 mins so we went down the block for some drinks. Typically when I get crappy attitude from the get go I don't bother putting my name down because there are a million spots that I can go to. It's NYC, competition is stiff and I'm not one to wait 90 mins for dinner when already hungry. Anyway, my friends really wanted to try La Contenta so I begrudgingly waited. We went back to check on the status of the reservation a bit earlier than 90 mins to make sure we were there when the table became available. When we inquired about our table, the hostess looked like she was exasperated with us for no reason. Her reply was "I told you it was busy, maybe another hour but I don't think you'll get in tonight". Umm excuse me? She definitely gave our table to another party... how do you work as a hostess and underestimate that badly?!We took our business elsewhere that night. I thought about going back to actually try the food but haven't bothered. And with that attitude at the door we'll probably will never try again. It's a shame how much business a restaurant can lose with shitty service. Came for an impromptu dinner with a friend. The place was packed and somehow they manged to make a space for us. Awesome customer service and fantastic drinks. The bartender will take care of you! The food was delicious! Authentic and flavorful. Our waiter was very helpful with recommendations. I don't know how he managed to make us feel so special with such a packed house. I will definitely return! I will be dreaming of the fish tacos here for the rest of my life. That's how good they were and that's how excited I am to get back here ASAP. Went for a friend's birthday, and I'm glad we picked this spot. I had a blackberry michelada, which the bartender was afraid I wasn't going to like because it tastes like a "citrusier" Bloody Mary (savory and spicy), but I thought the drink was excellent. We then ordered fish tacos (please see the first line for my description of the near orgasmic experience I had over those flaky, savory pockets of goodness). I then had the chicken mole which was nothing short of amazing. I've never had mole sauce that good and the chicken, ugh, I can't even talk about how fantastic it was. This is a much smaller location than the one on the west side, but if you're looking for good food and drinks on the LES, please, PLEASE, go check this place out. You won't regret it. And order the fish tacos for me, because I'm coming back for them. Waited for a while to get seat, it's worth doing that tho. Guacamole dip was better than most i've ever had. The spot was cozy, but the interior attracted me a lot, especially when it was close to the Halloween. This is a GREAT spot. I've been here twice now and have been so pleased both times. It's a super tiny restaurant, so make sure to make a reservation if you can! The happy hour is AMAZING! I believe it's from 5-7p weekdays, and it includes drinks AND food ($8 margaritas and $8 for 2 chicken tacos, for example - the full HH menu is on their website).Things I have gotten and loved include the margarita and the Mayan cocktails, the short rib tacos, chicken tacos, and of course guacamole + chips. Yum! Portions are an adequate size. The staff is always so kind and hospitable. Come on in! Great food, very interesting drinks. The happy hour is from 4-7 and it offers $8 drinks and menu items. I had the Torta and the Fish Tacos, both super tasty. I had The Mayan as my first drink and it was really interesting. I enjoyed it. I then had El Diablo which was supposed to be full of ginger with House made ginger beer, but I couldn't really taste any ginger. Overall I had a great time and look forward to visiting again! By far the best Mexican joint in all of the city. Excellent drinks and the fish taco is amazing. I had the Mixteco cocktail, so yummy. Cozy atmosphere, exquisite mezcal collection and fine authentic cuisine makes this place my fav as of yet. This place is tiny, but I love the decorations in the restaurant. The waiters and bartender are super nice, the drink was surprisingly good. A cozy, boozy spot for brunch! (Definitely wouldn't come here with more than 4 people)The bartender was great with a positive attitude, although I didn't order any drinks, it was fun to watch him mix them up. They have great Mexican versions of brunch classics like mimosas and "bloody marias" so I'll def have to order those next time.They give you chips and salsa while you wait and the music is great too! But the star is DEFINITELY the CHILAQUILES. It immediately pulled at my heartstrings as a Californian and is undoubtedly one of my favorite brunch foods.The chips were crispy, evenly and fully coated with the sauce and the eggs on top were perfect. It didn't look like much at first, but it was actually a lot! I was super full afterwards. My friend on the enchiladas which were also super good. The sauce wasn't super heavy or overly salted.I feel like we waited for our food for a while...maybe like 25 minutes or so but I think they were a bit backed up so it's understandable!I definitely recommend coming here if you're tired of the standard egg benedict/mimosa brunch. What a great little Mexican spot tucked away in the Lower East Side. It definitely lives up to the name. The place is extremely tiny, can maybe serve 15 people at a time at most. If you go at night, you're most likely going to have to wait. Waited around 45 minutes on a Tuesday night, but it is definitely worth it for those fish tacos. Got an order of just about every taco, all were good, but the fish taco is the one that I will definitely be returning for. Also have fantastic cocktails. Definitely up there for best Mexican food in New York City. This is a real hole in the wall place! I met up with a friend visiting from London and our significant others. After a major delay on the f train, I was the second person to arrive and we already had a table despite there being people waiting for seats outside the door. Probably less than 20 people total can fit into this restaurant at a time. The drinks were delicious and I did like the Frida kalo mug. After the other two arrived (both, like me, via the slow moving f train) we ordered a bunch of appetizers and had our meal brought to us tasting menu style. This gave us a great taste of what the restaurant had to offer. Everyone at the table thoroughly enjoyed the ceviche (which was extremely fresh) and the queso (which got pretty messy)which funnily enough was the first and last items brought to the table. I also enjoyed the fish tacos. I really appreciated that they sent out the items in a distinct order rather than having everything come at once and it really seemed to flow with the meal. Our server was also so sweet!! This place has a great atmosphere and feels like you're going to a cool place given the limited seating and intimate setting of the restaurant. I would 100% come here again and would love to try additional items off the menu! I came here for brunch - I loved this little place! Seats only 14 people and it was a cute whole-in-the-wall vibe. I also felt like I wasn't in NY...a quick vacation to Mexico?Ambience: 5-star - Restaurant is decorated in Mexican flag colors and Mexican artifacts. Loved it! It's very small, so get ready to squeeze tight. There's a 4 person outdoor patio and a bar and table area. Food: 4-star - loved the guacamole and the chilaquiles. It was so much food! I couldn't finish the chilaquiles. Guacamole was a bit too citrusy for my taste but my bf loved it. The chilaquiles is slightly spicy..be warned! It wasn't the BEST Mexican food I've had but it was still delicious. I would definitely recommend the place. Drinks: 3-star - I had the Bloody Maria - STRONG! Tequila flavor was a bit too strong for my taste. Service: 5-star - very sweet ladies who were extremely excited when I spoke in Spanish!If you want to feel like you're on vacation, go to La Contenta! Delicious food. Try the shrimp torta - it's incredible and a little different to your standard Mexican place. The Essex cocktail is nice and potent. The Mayan and beer cocktails also great. Bar tender was accommodating and lovely. We had the shrimp torta and queso - both delectable. Wasn't too busy 5.30 on a Friday. Cute atmosphere and a group celebrating a bday, all round good find and experience Omg. Everything was so tasty! The happy hour menu was delicious. We tried the guacamole, fish tacos, queso fundido, and the quesadilla (and another guac). My favorite was the guacamole, but I would gladly get everything again. The queso was just that - loads of delicious cheese. If I were getting food just for me, I'd get guac and the quesadilla so that it's not all just cheese. The place is small but it seemed that nobody had to wait on the frigid Jan 1 afternoon. It would probably be busier when it's not so cold. Service was amazing and all of our food came out really fast. Also, they weren't serving cocktails at the time, and my guess is that it has something to do with a liquor license issue in the new year. I'd definitely want to come back when they're serving cocktails. Cute spot with delicious food! Came here for dinner with my best friend and was not disappointed. Although busy at the time, we were able to grab a few seats at the bar. We started with the guac (just do it!) and then got Chile Relleno and tacos. Service was great and everyone was friendly. Definitely all good vibes.Despite it being a tiny place, we were never ignored or left hanging. If you're on the LES and craving Mexican food, please make a stop here. Came here on New Years Day for my besties bday because we were all craving nachos. I have to say, despite being tiny on space they are large on flavor!! The nachos, queso fundito and of course tacos are not to be missed!! The staff were warm and welcoming on a cold winter night and made every effort to make her bday special!!

I had the BEST time at La Esquina last weekend. It can be kind of tough to get a reservation, especially only a week or so before, but you can get lucky sometimes the day before with cancellations. A friend and I had an amazing dinner here. We ordered a bunch of small plates and shared everything. Some standouts for us were the tuna tostadas, the avocado ceviche (*****) and the Brussels sprouts of course :) The vibe here is so cool and trendy. You enter through the taqueria at street level and a bouncer guides you downstairs. Downstairs feels like a funky, super hip speakeasy. Stone walls, funky furniture and decorations all around. The tables are tight in some places and the music can get pretty loud at times so you may have to talk loud at dinner but for me that was not an issue. After dinner, my friend and I decided to hang at the bar for a while. The margs here are super strong and not too sweet. You can tell they don't use pre bought marg mixes. The bar area eventually turned into a big party with lots of dancing and an AMAZING DJ. I literally loved every single song he played. I can't believe I've lived in NYC for four years and never been here. Will DEFINITELY be returning soon! Monkeys!! Hmm, so I had trouble reviewing this place because it was a mixed bag, plus other than thinking the food was 'good', a couple of days afterwards I couldn't for the life of me recall what I'd actually eaten other than some tacos! Not a great sign.However after chatting with my dining companions, I can confirm we had the queso fundido (ok), 3 selections of tacos (good) and the chilaquiles (very good). Beer selection was very good.Sadly though, the service was lacking, very tough to get anyone's attention and for about 15 minutes there were zero staff in the room. Very much a look you up and down, judgy mcjudgerson kind of scene. We loved the monkey decor.. as you can see in our highly mature picture! Not sure if I'd return, this place was really hyped up and we were excited to go but ultimately, I just didn't feel comfortable or welcome. This place is very exclusive, and they have several different areas! I came one night for a birthday party and was only let in because I said my friends' name at the door, otherwise you need a reservation! My friend and I were escorted by the bouncer downstairs and another lady led us through the kitchen and into the bigger dining area. The food and drinks were pricey BUT the service was great aaaand truthfully most of the stars goes to the BOMB ass Branzino on their menu. I would go again just for that...Also I would definitely recommend this place for a birthday ! Ive never actually been to the sit down restaurant portion of la esquina. Oddly enough I didnt even know is was there at first. What I can tell you is the taco shop that looks like a delicatessen makes some incredibly succulent tacos. The tacos has extremely deep flavors. The lamb just melts in your mouth. The chicken is packed of flavor same for the ribeye.  The salsas are authentic and true to mexican flavors. My only gripes are that they dont double up on their corn tortillas. One barely holds up if you eat right away and if you wait at all you might as well eat it with a fork. Also mexican corn is rarely worth eating if its not roasted. It makes me so mad that what could be an amazing elote falls short because of steamed corn. Im going to try out the sit down menu as soon as I can ween myself off their tacos...so it might be awhile. I went to La Esquina with a friend on a Sunday around 5:00PM. My friend and I had to dine in the restaurant portion of La Esquina since the speakeasy around the corner doesn't open until 6:00PM. I had the blood orange margarita. It was delicious and our waitress was extremely attentive and sweet. However, the drinks were not very strong considering how expensive they were. Or they just took a little longer to hit me. One or the other. I was in Soho for work and had bookmarked Lombardi's for some good pizza. Made my coworkers trek all the way to Lombardi's only to find out it was cash only . Luckily one of my coworkers lives and works in NYC and suggested La Esquina. I was super bummed bc I had pizza on my mind. Nevertheless, we followed her to La Esquina. When we got to the building I was like "omg where is she taking us?" As you can see in pics on here, the outside looks really beat up. I was wondering if it was even sanitary to eat here lol. Anyways, we were seated outside at one of the red tables. It was a beautiful day out but I will say that if you have four people at one table, it's kinda cramped. But we made it work! My coworker recommended the guac and it was great! Very creamy and great taste. The chips were just alright. I ended up getting the chicken tacos with the salsa verde. Overall, I ended up being pleased with my meal. The tacos had a delicious corn tortilla, tender juicy chicken and great flavor (and I'm obsessed with salsa verde and they put a perfect amount on there). I will say though that for $10 you should get 3 tacos instead of 2. I left feeling satisfied but I could easily see someone getting hungry again within a few hours. Overall, I'd recommend it! Very authentic tacos and it seems to be where the locals go, so that's always a good sign! Came to this cute little cafe and sat outside during a great day! We ordered the Chile Relleno, Taco de Hongo, Elote, and Veggie Quesadillas with mushrooms and asparagus. We also had the Queso Fundido with pumpkin seeds which was different than other fundidos I've had since they had pumpkin seeds that were slightly glazed with honey. The fundido game with tortilla chips instead of tortillas, wish they gave flour tortillas.The chille relleno was on the spicier side which I enjoyed, as well as the quesadillas.Elote was on the cob, but tasty with extra lime!Overall really enjoyable, only downside was the fundido became cold quick and didn't give us enough chips as part of the app Amazing hole in the wall spot.  Small menu but tasty.  Had the pollo and pepito especial tortas.  The pollo was relatively standard but very good, and the pepito was the perfect mix of meaty, cheesy, creamy, spicy... fantastic.It is a tiny spot and it has an interesting vibe.  There is probably room for about 10 people inside, and if you are easily offended by loud, explicit music then this might not be the place for you.  I would definitely come back here and try out more of the menu.  My girlfriend and I literally stumbled upon this place as we were walking down the street, and it had kind of a grungy yet inviting look so we checked it out - and we're both glad that we did. OMG! I've walked past this place (and driven past it when i used to drive into the city) about a million times. When everything on the LES/NoLita area is booked solid and people are actually brunching OUTSIDE when it's windy and cold out...suddenly bodega breakfast tacos with a Mexican Coke sounds all right.But it was more than all right. I had an avocado taco and two breakfast tacos (huevos and salsa on soft corn tortillas - simple but it worked). My only gripe: it was kinda pricey for smallish tacos. BUT! It was very good. And i think I'd rather pay a little extra to keep an honest mom & pop shop in business than go to Taco Bell. Looking forward to my next visit. if you're looking for some quick eats and are in the mood for tacos and you happen to be in Manhattan this restaurant is a good bet. Divided into two parts: a fast food service side and a sit down restaurant la esquina promises to give you two distinct dining experiences. I'm giving this place 3 stars because while the tacos are good and the guacamole chip dip is a must order - it's really not the best I've ever had and is over priced at that. To be fair almost everything in NYC is overpriced so that's noting new but for the caliber of food served I can't help but feel a bit jaded. Anyway - this place isn't all that bad and definitely has potential so if you're just looking to satisfy your taco craving then I'd recommend - enjoy! I went in today because it is advertised that they are open at 11am. I went in about 11:15am assuming they are open. Nope. However, I waited patiently for the lady at the counter to get off the phone as I wanted to know when they would be open. Clearly she was stalling because she just wanted me to leave. Instead of asking if I needed help, I was addressed with utter disdain and hostility in her tone as she told me "Ma'am We're Closed!!!"I responded politely "Yes, well when would you be open?"Again her response to me was with utter disdain as she told me they were going to be open at noon, offering no explanation as to why they would be open late.I will not be coming back with service this bad. Food was very delicious and authentic! I ordered the mushroom enchiladas and chicken tortilla soup. Both were very soulful and warm for a cold day in nyc. The staff was extremely attentive and nice. My only complain is that when you walk in, it strongly smells like tequila. I guess depending on the mood it can either be a good fun start or reminder of last night regrets. Otherwise I will definitely be coming back for another meal!! Went here with another couple this weekend and was really really good. Very hard for me to give 5 stars but was high quality Mexican. We started off with the oysters, corn and ceviche (tuna and hamachi) tuna was ok, and you could argue not really ceviche, but the hamachi was top draw. Oysters were solid without being spectacular. Hard to stuff up corn. We were sucking down margaritas which I cannot remember the name of the tequila we ordered it with but it was the most expensive and the best. We then moved onto the beef rib, and tacos. We had the lamb shoulder, shrimp and fish. The shrimp was the best for mine, the lamb was slightly above average, the fish again was above average.  The beef rib was really tender, like pull apart style, but the waiter had recommended two rather than the 1 he should have. Doesn't matter though. I think my overall comment is there is a lot of hype around this place, you can't get a reservation etc. it isn't as good as you are expecting though. It is good, and really worth going, but it isn't going to change your life. Food 4/5Service 4/5Ambiance 4/5 (my wife had this weird feeling of light headedness and had trouble getting up the stairs. It was like there wasn't enough oxygen down there. She is fit and healthy, it was weird. Made doubly weird by another woman suffering the same thing when we got outside. They should look into the ventilation down there. She was fine in the end. ) This is a 3 part restaurant.1 part taco stand/taqueria, where you order at the takeout window.  There's zero seating, & zero frills.  The top floor.1 part cafe.  Also zero frills, also on the top floor.1 part sexy "brasserie."  Downstairs, down a hall, down more stairs, through the kitchen, past coat check, around the corner.I only did the downstairs brasserie.  And I loved everything about it.It's dark.  It's cavernous.  It's sexy.  It's intimate.  It's loud.  It's fun.  It's a little funky.  It's dark (see pics).The food.  So good.  The cheesy appetizer in salsa was delicious.  The tortilla soup was delicious.  The tuna tartare, the vegetarian app, the carnitas tacos were delicious.  Everything was delicious.  Be warned that portions can be on the small side (sometimes very) for many items.  It's more Mexican tapas style dining.  But items like the cheesy app & the tortilla soup were more than enough for two people (though wouldn't be for three); it depends on what you order.The margaritas.  Order one.  Or three.  I tried the blood orange margarita, because I figured I would be getting a nice dose of vitamin C.  Also delicious.  Also on the small side.  Probably a good thing.This is a spot you'll always remember, & it's equally ideal for a date as it is for a large group.  There's a lot of joie de vivre, a lot of happiness in the air.  You can feel that many memories have been made here.With good food & margaritas.Reservations are absolutely necessary for the sexy brasserie downstairs.  And if you don't reserve enough in advance, you'll be eating at 5:00 or 11:00.  I found it strange that it's called a "brasserie," since this is certainly a Mexican restaurant, & certainly not a French one.  But it's a pretty perfect spot, so they can call it whatever they like.I won't return to NYC without coming back to La Esquina.5 stars. This is a review for the downstairs brassiere area. This place is AMAZING and such a fun time, definitely recommend for groups. The food is fantastic, high quality Mexican food that cannot be beat elsewhere. I'm honestly in love with this place. It also has fantastic cocktails. I went on a Tuesday and it was still absolutely lit, the group ended up just drinking and dancing in the bar area for another hour or two after we had finished our meal. SO much fun! I'm not sure what's so amazing about this place. The wait for a table for two was over an hour on a Thursday night. When they finally seated us, we were sitting so close to the two tables on either side, we might as well have been in communal seating. I hate it when restaurants do this - I realize that it's a bit of a necessity in NYC because the cost of real estate is so high, but I hate it when the tables are so close that you need to move the table to one side to let people squeeze into their seat.I ordered the enchilada and it was ok. The tortilla was good, but the mole sauce was so bitter that I didn't enjoy it. Also ordered the corn that everyone raves about, which I thought was just ok. Is this really the best that NYC can offer for Mexican / Spanish food?If you're absolutely craving Mexican food and want it in a hip environment, stop by. But between the bland flavors, long waits, tight seating, and poor value (price/quality), I would seek another place. Great underground speakeasy spot... huge tequila selection. Great selection of Mexican beers with huge slices of lime on top. Got the queso fundido which was delicious! Came with pumpkin seeds, agave syrup and some kind of powder which made it taste even better. The chicken tostadas were great, a bit small, but rich and tasty. The lamb and brisket tacos were pretty filling, and would highly recommend. Waiter was attentive and service was quick. We had the Mahi mahi tacos as well as the chicken tacos- the mahi mahi was definitely my favorite. The fish was juicy and overall delicious! We had the guacamole as well- I love guacamole but personally didn't feel it was worth the price especially because it was a relatively small portion. As for the service- we had a very annoying waiter that kept being over friendly to the point it made us uncomfortable and annoyed. Overall, I would definitely come back for the mahi mahi tacos- just will probably take them to go! La Esquinaaaaaah! Have you guys been yet?! Flashback to a few weeks ago. The corner on great Mexican food in the city no question. Always on the taco hit list when we visit. It's no non-sense at @esquinanyc. This taco: fresh tortilla with crispy cheese and a tasty slab of thin bistec with perfectly paired salsa verde. Amazing. And they're expanding from SOHO to all over NYC -- did you hear the collective "hallelujah!" from taco lovers everywhere?!?  Big things to come... Fun night out at La Esquina! We had late reservations (10pm) to the downstairs restaurant and had a great time. Loud music, great food, and a solid variety of margaritas. We had several of the different types of tacos which I recommend, especially the barbacoa. We also enjoyed several jalapeo margaritas and the staff was very attentive. I loved going late when the DJ is playing and place really gets going. Definitely recommend for a fun night out.

I spent my first weekend in NY walking 10 miles in 20 degree weather post-cyclone looking at overpriced walkups, wondering why the hell I moved here from Los Angeles. Starving, I Yelped the closest pizza place and had my answer. New York is the only city where, despite everything, you can walk into any neighborhood and find a slice of pizza that makes you forget everything you loved in your west coast past life. I used to think Joe's was the best, but this definitely took that spot. I thought, maybe I'm wrong. Maybe this just tasted so good because I was hungry that day and it was cold. To test this, I came here multiple nights in a row and still experienced no diminishing marginal returns. Instead, each visit made me crave this place more. The normal/triangular/non-square margarita is my fave. And although a warm slice tastes great while you're walking outside and makes you forget how cold it is, I much prefer to enjoy these in the large seating area in the back to fully engage in the experience. I got the chicken bacon ranch which I didn't like, the ranch dressing used was almost watery and made the pizza surprisingly worse. I also got the margarita with pesto which was a 4/5, the thickness of the slice was between a flatbread and a regular pizza. Yummy pizza! We got the margarita and a bbq chicken slice and both were amazing. Cheap at $7 for two slices. Square slices that they heat up for you. R. is in the building ummm pizzeria.the pizza joint is clean and bright enough. it's on the smallish medium side. it's more of a grab and go spot with the standard set up. i'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area to drink.this is not an average pizza spot. pizza is solid and good. nothing to write to Michelin star guys about, though. it's close enough to the bars in the area and is open late enough...you can your drunken hangry-ness on. pizza aside, it's time to get in the 'ZONE. the CALZONE! the sauseeeeeege calzone is awesome and bigger than your head. it comes with a marinara dipping sauce. the cheesiness melds with the fatty pork and is cradled in a thin munchy cruncy dough. you can't go wrong on with taking a tour through the calzones. the sausage 'zone is delicious. the spinach one as well as the ham calzone are good bets on ending any hunger. wished they did pepperoni calzones though. calzones are all like $8-$9 and are equivalent to 1.5 meals.the staff is efficient and chill, despite sweating in pizza-oven-land. drops mic cuz this calzone is a two-hand mofoi out.zzz Really happenin' spot. They feature the famed Margherita pie as aptly named. They have an ATM inside if you don't happen to have cash on your hands. This place is a favorite among the locals, I came in here tonite thinking it would be slow given its a weekday. Nope, it felt like Saturday night. They have a variety of different pies, some with meat, some only veggies. I had their Margherita slice, but also requested to add extra fresh mozzarella cheese. I can NEVER get enough cheese :D Cash only. 3.5 stars. Informal tiny spot with tasty pizza by the slice. They have a good selection, and you can both get a thin slice from a round pizza, or a thicker square piece. I had a square margherita, and thoroughly enjoyed. The ingredients were fresh and the price cheap ($3.50). There are a few seats by tiny wooden tables, so you can eat there. The service was very nice. Good $2 pizza (but it's $2 before 6pm). For a basic pizza joint (as opposed to specialty pizza and the like), La Margarita is great. We were roaming around LES and stumbled upon La Margarita at around 11:30PM on a Tuesday night - we had just experienced a double overtime nail-biter at Barclays Center and were in need of some fuel after all the energy expended. We ordered a slice of margarita and a slice with breaded chicken, jalapeno, tomato, and onions (and ended up ordering seconds). Wow... The crust was pretty magnificent. If you like crispier crusts, this will no doubt impress. Both slices were packed with flavor, each bite striking the perfect balance between crust and toppings. More importantly, the pizza was NOT drenched in excess oil. Delicious pizza. Delicious prices. Will definitely be coming back for any late-night pizza emergencies.CREDIT MINIMUM $10 - there is an ATM inside Unfortunately the pizza was undercooked and under seasoned. I've had other champion pizzas that were much more amazing so unfortunately this really fell flat for me. I just moved to NY from Boston and have been craving for some pizza. I tried out La Margarita Pizza and it was the best pizza I've had so far. Definitely a must try! As a regular who eats all of the time, my latest visit on Nov. 28 makes me reconsider my options. What I am basically upset about, is when the cashier charged me extra without telling me and when I asked him about it, he realized he made a mistake but instead of owning up to it, he started to become defensive. It gets even worse. As I was about to leave, he threw my change (the extra amount he charged me) at the counter near me which I don't need to say how disrespectful that is. Not going to lie, the food is good. Maybe this was just a miscommunication between the cashier and I but it ended up really upsetting me and I think the shop should own up to it. Unfortunately I didnt make it to infamous $2 slice time.Ordered two margarita slices for $7.And.it.was.good.!!Love the crispy crust, saucey tomato, and fresh mozzarella cheese. Definitely one of the top 3 best slices of pizza I've ever had. Came here on a Friday morning around 130 am and tried the sausage pizza with ricotta. It was around $3 for a square slice. I was so impressed that the crust held everything together so well. The worst is when you pick up a slice of pizza and things start falling off the side but this place cooks it to perfection. The crust was crunchy but not too dense, the marinara sauce tasted fresh, and the sausage added a nice meaty savoriness. I liked the touch of ricotta because it wasn't overly heavy but added creaminess to each bite. Loved this little find after a night out, I would definitely recommend it! In lower manhattan to catch open mic night at the nyorican poets cafe. Left hungry in search of food. My daughter had a taste for pizza. So off we went in search of. We landed here. She's already eaten here once before and said the pizza was good. Well she didn't lie. For late night pizza it was very good!!! The crust was nice and crisp the cheese was not heavy and the sauce was very flavorful. It's a bit of a dive. But sometimes that's where the best food is. The best pizza I've had in NY so far. I got the signature Margarita pizza and it was incredible. The cheese was had a great flavor to it and the tomato sauce was noticeably fresh. At a price point of $3, I would definitely go back to this place. Ordered their BBQ chicken large pie for delivery.  Came faster than i expected.  Delivery guy was friendly.  He was a little confused with our address but in the end worked out fine and i got my pizza.The appearance of the pizza was nice and eye catching.  The bbq sauce was placed in ring shapes on the pizza.  The chicken pieces were cut into small chunks and was not dry.  The pizza was thin crusted and tasted fresh.  Overall, their pizza is of good quality.  Fast delivery.  Would like to try their other pizza and see if it is as impressive. This pizza joint was just down the street from my hotel and had excellent ratings so I decided to give it a shot. I love NY pizza but I also know NY has its fair share of bad pizza joints, so I was cautiously optimistic. I have a rule about the name of a restaurant. If a resturant is brave enough to name themselves after a specific dish then I always have to order that dish. In this example I knew I had to order the margarita. I also went for the pasta pizza which has actual penne pizza on top of it.  The penne pasta was disappointing as it had melted cheese on it but should have had more sauce on top of it. I thought the texture of the penne conflicted with the pizza crust and also didn't add much in terms of favor. So for me it was unneeded texture to a crust that was already perfect in texture and flavor.  My margarita pizza on the other hand was very good. They claim to have a a special recipe and it gave the pizza a nice twist in flavor. The reason I couldn't give this place a 4 star was because my penne pasta was only so so and both my pizza was undercooked and only luke warm.  Very disappointing... went here after happy hour to get a pick me up in the form of delicious margarita pizza. I got both a margarita slice as well as a sausage with ricotta slice, both of which were amazing in quality of ingredients, crispiness of crust, as well as deliciousness. This place is a solid place to get a classic, better than a $1 slice pizza, better than touristy Lombardi's pizza(had it the day after and the comparison was not good for Lombardis), ny neapolitan/square slices of pizza. If this was in the my neighborhood I'd totally drop by to get a slice here and there. All the different types of pizza we got were amazing. Heated to perfection with just the right amount of crisp. The best I've had in a longgggg time! In need of some late night pizza, La Margarita seemed like the best candidate (great reviews and only one block away from where we were).  The pizza is SO delicious - crispy thin crust with an excellent sauce/topping ratio!  I got a Margarita slice (amazing) and a chicken Bleu cheese square slice (good if you're in the mood for those flavors).  Two quality slices for $7... doesn't get better than that!  Can't wait to come back and try more!It's important to note that this seems to be a very popular and packed pizza parlor... space and seating is very limited so keep that in mind if you're trying to grab some slices with a group on a cold night!

After my first bite, I'm fairly certain that I died and went to carb heaven..As a child of a long line of Chinese chefs in my family, I was hoping for the best. Prices are so cheap, 4$ for 8 dumplings and around 6$ for a noodle dish. I took my first bite of pork dumpling and was so taken aback by the flavors, the juices, the deliciousness of the thin wrapper and the filling. Legit, best dumplings I've had in my life--which is quite impressive as I can't even compare these to my family's. I did it!!! I found the best dumplings in the world.Zha zian mien had loads of noodles and a good amount of pork topping. Noodles were perfectly chewy and delicious. Don't forget that it's cash only!!!! FOOD: 7/10SERVICE: 7/10AMBIENCE: 6/10PRICE: $RECCOMENDATION: 8 fried dumplings for $4This place was pretty good, so far I went to a couple different hand pulled noodle spots and this one was mediocre; the broth didn't really have that much flavor. However the pan fried dumplings were delicious BUT sadly they changed the price from 10 for $3 to 8 for 4. *cry cry cry* I want me my extra 2 dumplings. I love noodles, so any kind of noodle place already has a head start when it comes to me. I got the house special noodle soup and shared pan-fried dumplings with my boyfriend, both of which were delicious and affordable (noodles were around $9, dumplings were $4). Noodles were firm and delicious, as was the variety of meat in the soup.Depending on who you're talking to, things may get lost in translation, but we personally had no trouble getting our food.Side note about drinks: When asking for water, they said they only had bottled water and proceeded to charge us for it, but it's only $1 each.Also, they serve soda in the can, so if you wanted it in a cup like the lady next to us, you'll have to drink it out of a tiny Chinese teacup; otherwise, you'll have to settle for a straw.It wasn't crowded on a Sunday morning, and honestly this place isn't too special. That being said, it's still a great place for a quick, warm meal. While other noodle shops in the area were packed, this restaurant had open tables so I opted to have my lunch here. A bowl of noodles is around $5. The noodles are pretty tasty although my bowl of beef tendon hand pulled noodle soup contained some chunks of pure tendon/fat(?) without any attached meat. Those were not very appetizing and had a coppery taste to them. The service left something to be desired but then again it is Chinatown. My table had no utensils or napkins so I had to steal from the neighboring table. Most of the staff wear their winter coats while working since the heat wasn't on. It's a decent place to grab lunch without a wait but there are better options nearby. Ummm...I guess I'm the odd ball for not enjoying this place as much as others. I like Very Fresh Noodles 10x better!Came here on a rainy day and this place was empty, about two other person were eating in the restaurant. I ordered #2 beef brisket soup noodles ($8). After tasting the broth, I thought it was average at most and the beef was so chewy. Boo!Finally I can cross this off my list of noodles place to try in NYC, but sadly I don't think I will be coming back. Very quick and delicious noodles and dumplings. My friend and I ordered the beef noodles ( number 1) and boiled dumplings. The beef noodles came with some bok choy. One star off because the waitress wasn't very helpful. We didn't have any utensils or sauces in our table and I had to go grab it myself. Also they gave us the wrong bowl of noodles the first time around. Fried dumplings are delicious. The skins aren't too thick and the dumplings aren't too greasy. The sauce is also well made and works well with the dumplings.The House Noodles are plentiful, flavorful, and filling.Service is lacking. You need to work hard to flag someone down. Also water is bottled; you have to buy it or no water for you! Ordered the Lamb Noodle Soup and my mom had the Duck Noodle Soup- both of which were absolutely terrible. I took one bite of the lamb (I'm generally a big fan of lamb) and couldn't stand the taste- it tasted old, super gamey, and was at least 1/2 bones. There was absolutely no flavor. My mom's duck noodle soup was 90% duck neck bones, so rendered inedible. Noodle consistency nothing to write home about either. Dumplings mediocre, lots of chives. I DEFINITELY would not be back. Absolutely did *NOT* live up to the hype for me. (recommended alternative: Tasty Hand Pull Noodles on Pell St).Only pro: it's Clean, since it's a newly renovated establishment. However, half the old tables and chairs were brought over from the old location so it's a weird mix of old furniture + new. bathrooms in the basement. With a new revamped location, had to come back to try some more noodles. Saturday afternoon, was able to get a table for seven right before the place started filling up (it's fairly popular).To start off, shared the Fried Dumplings ($4), Boiled Dumplings ($4) and Sweet Rice Balls ($4). Fried dumplings were crisp and not too greasy. The boiled dumplings made more of a mess; juicy on the inside plus needing some extra sauce for flavor. Rice balls looked more like dumplings and had a distinct brown sugar taste to them. For the main course, ordered the Beef Brisket Cut Noodle ($9.50) - a heaping portion of noodles with big cuts of beef swimming in a hot beef broth. Extremely filling; especially the firm noodles+heavy meat combo.Dropped a star from my last visit because the service took a downturn. Despite the large group they didn't provide adequate utensils or plates. Also, one of the vegetarian soups had a distinct meat flavor in the broth. Want to come back again, but maybe for takeout. I finally made it to Lam Zhou, which has been on my list for years. The pan fried dumplings were good, which is my reason for giving 3 stars, however every thing else was quite disappointing. The restaurant itself looked so run down and dirty. I guess this is your hole in the wall place. When you try to ask for a cup of water, they tell you to get it yourself in the back. The tables are set up in a way to make it impossible for servers to bring trays of dumplings or hot noodle soup to the inner row closest to the wall. I basically had to duck twice in order to not be beheaded by a plate of dumplings and a second time by a tray of hot noodles. The noodles themselves were okay. For the price, I would expect there to be more much more meat in the dish. My friend ordered the lamb and I had the beef brisket. We felt the bowls were too noodle heavy. Also, the broth was not very flavorful at all and needed to be jazzed up with the chili oils, sriracha or unlabeled sweet/vinegar sauce. The hand pulled noodles is relatively cheap and it comes very quick. I ordered the beef tedon noodle soup. The bowl isn't that big but they do give a good amount of noodles. The broth is good. I do wish they had a combination beef noodle option so I'm not just limited to one type of beef.We also ordered the boiled dumplings which comes in 8 for $4.The service isn't the best, but if you want hand pulled noodles this is a quick and cheap option.I think this is cash After seeing all the positive reviews for this place the GF and I decided to stop in on New Years and try it out for ourselves. The experience left me very disappointed. While I did not have the pleasure of experiencing the old location, the new location seems a bit too big. We ordered the following:1x Beef Noodle Soup $7 - Pretty decent. Soup is good. Meat was too fatty.1x Beef Fried Noodles $8.50 - This was very delicious, but meat fatty here as well (same meat)1x Fried Dumplings (8) - $4 - Amazing taste, but I prefer East Dumpling or Tasty Dumping better.1x Sweet Rice Ball (8) $4 - This is like mochi texture, with peanut sauce inside. I love this dish usually, but here they really skimping on the filling.....didn't taste as good as I wished it had.The meat that they use is basically the same for all items. Overall the prices were not very cheap as they were in the old place. So basically you are getting the same thing you got before but much 20%+ more expensive. Additionally, on the receipts it has a spot for "tipping"... meh basically didn't even get much service and kinda incited us to tip. While I know tipping is optional with it being on the receipt made it feel pretty incited to tip especially since we sat down and ate in the restaurant..... Waters are extra here too so WTF am I tipping for?? Overall not a great experience and will not be back. Honestly, I thought this place was pretty average. The bf has been wanting to try it for a while bc of all of the yelp reviews and we were a little let down. I got the beef noodle soup and he got the beef stir fry noodles. They tasted the same and the beef was the exact same. We also got some dumplings (also the same meat as the soup/stir fry) which was a light spot but east dumpling is still better. To end the meal we had sweet rice balls with peanuts in the middle that were also pretty subpar. Overall I don't get the hype at all. This is pretty much the same as Shu Jiao Fu Zhou but more expensive and better dumplings. Atleast at Shu Jiao the soup is only $3. It's hard to go back to packaged noodles after eating here. BF and I came here on a COLD day in NYC, so handmade noodles in a warm, comforting broth was just what was needed. Dining space is pretty limited, but we were able to get seated right away. Ten minutes later, that was not the case! I got noodles with pork dumplings in soup. BF opted for stir fry noodles. Both were very good!! The dumplings were very flavorful and the noodles... omg. I can't wait to go back to NYC and eat more!!One thing to note-- cash only. I didn't know this and luckily BF and I had just enough cash for meal/tip. Plan accordingly! OMG! This place recently moved to a bigger location and after trying their food we could see why. We started with the boiled dumplingsThe skin was firm and the meat was perfect. It had scallions and pork inside. It wasn't just a frozen ball of pork, you could tell they were handmade fresh. They were also portioned out equally making each bite as delicious as the last. Of course we had to try the handmade noodles. We got beef brisket and tendon noodle soup. The broth was spectacular and wasn't overpowering. It was beefy and perfect for a cold day. It matched perfectly with the noodles, not overpowering them, letting the noodles be the star of the dish. The were cooked el dent. They had the perfect consistency and texture for slurping. The noodles had its own unique flavour that also complimented the broth. The brisket and tendonts were perfectly cooked and again complimented the noodles well. Again the only downside for us was this was a cash only establishment, so we missed out on those points. On a cold chilly day in New York City, a beef noodle soup from Lam Zhou Handmade Noodle & Dumpling is the way to go. Beefy soup broth. Beef is tender and juicy. The noodles are thick and delicious. Also got an order of boiled dumplings, which were super juicy and a lot of filling inside. All that..,Price is very affordable. Can't go wrong with noodle soup and dumplings. So good, I die. The winter freeze was getting to me, especially since I had spent a whole day walking around doing touristy shenanigans. We found this place via Yelp and decided to give it a try. So happy we ended up here. I got the beef noodle soup and Sam got the pork broth soup along with fried potstickers. It was the perfect way to defrost and have a nice home cooked meal for dinner. We barely spoke for like the first 15 minutes, just slurping away and chomping on potstickers. The potstickers were so good that we had it twice. On the first round, Sam was eyeing the last potsticker and saw me narrowing my eyes at him, so he ordered another round. Great boyfriend that fella. Plus, the prices are so hard to beat. Our noodles were like $7-8, which is insane!  The only annoying thing was the door. It kept slamming shut every minute a person walked in or out. Like damn, put some duct tape on the wall to help with the banging. It scared the crap out of me each time and trust me, it's not fun choking on your noodles. New location, right next to the parking lot on Bowery. Inside was very cold. Seems like they didn't turn on the heat but the noodle soups and dumplings will warm you up. They only have pork dumplings. No veg option for boo boo. i order the beef noodle soup with tendon and Boo Boo got the regular beef noodle soup and gave me all her beef. The broth is lacking is flavor. The noodles are soft and chewy with good bounce. The dumpling are great. I would get the 50 frozen pieces for i think $11 and make it at home.Service is lacking so order everything you want including water and drink when the lady comes to you.  Bathroom downstairs. This place is UHH-MAZING! This was my second time coming here and I got lost because they changed their location to a bigger restaurant interior, which is really nice because their previous location was sooo tiny. I order the same thing every single time (because it never fails me!) 1 order of beef noodle soup and fried dumplings for a total of $12! The place is also good for large groups, they have big round tables that can sit about 7-8 people. The service is super quick as they have a limited menu but the food is always hot and fresh!Their noodle soups are so flavorful and for only $7 a bowl, it sure fills you up! They even add some baby bak choy veggies which makes you feel less guilty ;). The noodles always taste fresh and they don't skimp on the noodles that's for sure! The dumpling order comes with 8 pieces for $4, although before I remember it being 10 pieces for the same price but I guess they are growing and raised up their prices a bit. However, I will say the menu is limited so don't expect to choose from a huge variety, it is mostly different types of meats in their noodle soups and dumplings (boiled, fried, veggie, pork, beef, etc.) PSA: They don't give you the complimentary water, you have to purchase bottled water which is $1. Maybe in the future they will change that but still not a huge deal breaker. Lam Zhou is a Chinatown institution that used to reside on the other side of Chinatown.  For a time, it closed and people feared a beloved shop was gone forever, but now it has returned in the space formerly known as Ken's Asian Taste.  Ken's Asian Taste was (for lack of a better term) terrible, so I was very happy when I read online that this restaurant was taking the space over.Not much has changed inside the restaurant in terms of decor.  For instance, while this is now a noodle and dumpling shop, the main counter when you walk in still has steamer equipment for Dim Sum (which they don't sell as far as I can tell).  Also, there is still an additional dining area downstairs, but I don't think it is maintained any longer.  The stairs going downstairs are still a bit slippery though, so use the banister.Service is pretty Old Skool Chinese.  No smiles, abrupt but efficient and quick.  The staff seems accustomed to dealing with both a Chinese and non-Chinese crowd which is great.  This place has gained notoriety over the years and plenty of folks who don't come to Chinatown often want to check it out.  That was encouraging to hear as this would be my first time having Lam Zhou's food (no, really).One great sign is when you get to a table and there is a ton of stuff on it already.  Chopsticks, forks, spoons (plastic ones, and not soup spoons - an odd choice) and sauces including hot chili oil (my favorite).  No need to ask the waitstaff for any extra stuff, it's all there waiting for you.I ordered a soup noodle that had both brisket and tendon.  The broth had a wonderfully rich flavor.  There were *plenty* of noodles.  It is highly unlikely you will walk out of here hungry.  The brisket tasted great and had a good texture.  The tendon was cooked perfectly (read: not rubbery).  I also added an egg to the dish for some extra protein and it went very well with the broth.  The noodles had just the right chew and tasted great (especially once I dropped in some chili oil!).  My girlfriend and I also shared an order of dumplings.  They were freshly made and good, but not the best I've ever had.  They did go nicely with my broth.  She had a lo mein style noodle dish but I did not manage to partake in it.Great food, a Chinatown institution and replacing a bad restaurant?  There's nothing but win here.  Check it out!

Great spot to hit if you're looking for a quick bite in the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Convenient to get to since it's a block away from the East Broadway station on the F line and right by the Williamsburg bridge. A lot of dessert spots and bars near by if you want to get dessert or a drink after. It's a really small spot but ambience is nice. Great lighting and really chill music inside. They use Square so they accept cash and card.The menu is simple and easy to read. They offer quite a variety of options from burgers and sandwiches to sides to drinks. The mint lemonade is perfectly sweet still with the sourness of the lemon to it but not too overwhelming. The touch of mint inside makes the drink really refreshing. I came here twice and here are a couple of the things I have tried:LES Bacon Fries ($7): Fries topped with caramelized onion, cheddar sauce, and bacon. The fries are skinny & cooked really crispy. The cheese sauce compliments the fries really well keeping the dish nice and warm. They don't skimp on the bacon as well.The Kitchen Sink ($12): Loaded Cheese fries topped with roast pork, ribeye steak, fried egg, peppers, bacon, caramelized onion. The portion is huge!! Shared it with two other friends and we still were not able to finish. Every bite was filled with flavor. Mac and Cheese Jalapeo Poppers ($4.50): Deep fried Mac and Cheese bites. BEWARE of burning yourself because they are hot!! A MUST TRY IF IF YOU GO HERE.  The manager was super friendly. Service is quick!! We got our food within 5 minutes of ordering. Definitely coming back to try their sandwiches next time. This spot is one of my go to spots for a burger.Food: Many different options for sandwiches but I love their burgers. I always make it a double and I've tried most of their options. Had the Mac attack with double fried chicken which comes with some delicious Mac n Cheese. The fries are good and  you pretty much can't wrong with any burger/item on the menu. The place is small but has a good vibe as they blast hip hop music and even take request sometimes.  The staff is real chill and make you feel welcomed. Always satisfied when I come here and i recommend trying every burger on the menu. Also, don't be scared to add an extra patty...... you'll thank me later. We were psyched to finally make it here after seeing all of the mouth watering food on instagram.  While the menu is small, but creative and with plenty of variety, I had high expectations in terms of presentation. Their photos on social media depict these massive sandwiches and burgers oozing with cheese or sauce/dressing and toppings.  Talk about mouth watering!  Unfortunately,  what we got had nothing on the photos we saw online.  Take a look for yourselves.  Kudos to management, because they clearly have perfected the art of taking amazing pictures and have achieved 35,000 followers on instagram as a result .I can't completely hate on them, because everything we had was tasty and the girl working was the nicest!  I'm not writing them off by any means, we will most likely be back again. I just wish our food looked as big and mouth watering as what is advertised. My friend and I have been following L.E.S. kitchen on instagram for awhile; therefore, we had been craving their food for awhile. We finally made it in on a Saturday night around 8pm. We were greeted by the guy behind the counter who gave us a few minutes to check out the menu. My friend ordered the kitchen sink fries while I ordered the L.E.S. Burger and the bacon cheese fries. Everything we ate here was delicious! Unfortunately, our pics didn't come out as good as the Instagram pictures but we were definitely satisfied with the taste of everything. We both left very full; I couldn't even finish my fries. We were also very satisfied with atmosphere with the loud rap music playing. It was warm and cozy with lots of good vibes. It's a pretty small space. Only sits about 7-10 people. Thankfully we were the only ones to get our food to stay. Overall, I'd definitely return and recommend L.E.S. Kitchen to anyone in the area. I be cheesing for some mac and cheese balls! I saw the macaroni and cheese balls and I knew I had to come. Unfortunately this place was quite a disappointment. I got the Angry Bird Chicken sandwich and the chicken was pretty dry. Good fried chicken should be moist and tender and crispy on the outside. The sandwich couldn't compare to some of the chicken sandwiches I get in Los Angeles. Also I tried their macaroni and cheese jalapeo popper balls. Fried macaroni and cheese balls are one of my favorite foods and I left some on my plate... that's always a bad sign when I leave food behind. My friend got a hamburger and said it tasted homemade, and not in a good way. It tasted like something she makes at home. However we both liked the tater tot's, but her comment to me was who messes up tater tot's? This place is very small and didn't feel quite a restaurant. It was more like a small shop. This restaurant could probably fit 7 people and that's  max. The only thing I liked about this was there was a place to charge my phone and the service was nice. Even though we sat at the bar, that was pretty much the only place to sit. Lastly there was no public bathroom! It's hard enough finding a bathroom in New York so I usually wait until I arrive at one of my locations to use the restroom. Not many places want to let you use the restroom unless you're a customer. I was disappointed that after I ordered I had to go and search for a bathroom which was hard! I think one visit was enough. Even though the prices were pretty reasonable there's way too much better food out in New York than to waste another visit. I came upon this hidden gem across Instagram and through many friends social media pages. I have been wanting to try this place for quite a while now, and this establishment has exceeded up to my expectations. The food is amazing and came out relatively quick (5-10 minutes)!! The environment is very chill and I definitely needed to point out the music, the music playlist is A1! So far I have tried "The Kitchen Sink" and the "Fresh Squeezed Mint Lemonade". I would definitely recommend the mint lemonade.  The lemonade was indeed freshly prepared and was totally refreshing. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but I'd rather have Shake Shack. Everything looked very appetizing on their menu, I opted for their Truffle Shuffle. My group of friends ordered the bacon/cheese fries and two LES Burgers. The grilled portabello mushrooms were underwhelming and the burger was terribly put together. So lucky to have a solid burger joint in my neighborhood. Cozy seating area with fun decor to keep your eyes busy. The forks/knives are even hidden in small wooden drawers which makes me feel like this place values the details. The burger and tots are great. They were exactly what I expected and wished for especially for the price.Go here for a quick burger craving! Came here with a friend the other day and it was absolutely amazing. The food here is incredible. I got a mighty bacon (cheese burger) for $9 and added on some ribeye cheese steak for an extra $3. The burger itself was amazing but the cheesesteak was over the top. Honestly, the bacon was a little excessive so next time, I would go for the LES (basic) burger and add the cheesesteak on top of that. I think that that would be perfect. Also very decent prices for such a great burger. Unfortunately, it does not come with fries, so definitely order the tots on the side! They're so crispy and delicious. Can't go wrong.My friend ordered the mac and cheese jalapeno poppers. They were a little underwhelming. I also have 0 spice tolerance and they were pretty spicy. My friend has a high tolerance and said that they weren't spicy, so I would gauge that its somewhere in between. Finally, I never order a drink, but decided to get the mint lemonade. That was so delicious and refreshing. If you are like me, you can ask for less sugar and it really hits the spot. Don't come here with a large group expecting to sit though. There is one table that seats maybe four people and 5-6 seats at the bar. We came late so we were able to grab some seats at the bar, but I think that most times it is packed. Def will stop by the next time I'm in the area. Probably one of my most favorite meals out in NYC. Saw this place commercialized on instagram before our vacation and made it a must to stop by and try. We got lucky by coming in when no one was there and was able to score the ONE dine-in table they have for 4 people. They have a counter with stools that on fire about 5 people altogether. So just a heads up, the place is tiny! But that's New York for ya. Mac & chess jalapeo poppers - HELLLLLA GOOD and very filling. Don't let those little balls fool you. The Kitchen Sink - perfect meat to fries ratio! And the sauce was so good. Pretty big portion too.LES cheesesteak - not recommended. It was just WAY too much bread and not enough meat. Had way better cheesesteaks other places.Angry Bird - HUGE piece of chicken in the sand which. Bigger the better when buying food!There was so much more on the menu I wanted to try but just knew I wouldn't have enough room in my tummy!! The burgers look/sound really good. Definitely coming back next time in town to try the other items! Walked to this small eatery late Saturday night to satiate unhealthy food cravings. Surprisingly not many people inside (all the counter space was open), so was able to order pretty fast.Decided on the Mac Attack Sandwich ($10) and the LES Bacon Fries ($7). Sandwich includes a deep fried piece of white meat chicken with a scoop of not-too-creamy mac and cheese on top. Fairly basic in preparation, but actually quite good with some hot sauce on top. The bacon fries are extremely heavy, a bucket of hot fries with cut of pieces of bacon and a slathering of melted cheese. All in all, way too much for me to finish (also felt mozzarella cheese would have been a better choice). No alcoholic drinks to speak of here, which is just fine as this is more of a spot you should be sobering up at. More of a 3.5 star place, but bumped up due to speed of service and value. This small low lit little space makes burgers.   A small speaker was adequately playing hip hop and you almost felt like you were at someone's chill house.The place was calm.  On my first visit, I got the truffle burger with provolone, mushrooms, caramelized onions.   God it was good.The burger was oily, dripping,  with the cheese oozing and the threads stretching out, the bun was soft, and not too large, the beef was noticeable pink and didn't taste cheap.  The burger was $9 and didn't come with fries.  It felt like what a burger is supposed to be.Big enough to not need anything else.Greasy enough, good beef quality.Shit.  These guys nailed it. On my second visit, I order just the plain burger for $6.5 and it was much less exciting, if actually ordinary.  The patty was cooked medium which wasn't flattering.  It had that cardboard texture and soy taste going on. The mac and cheese balls were good, but not amazing somehow.  The have jalapeos in them so that's fun. Details There's one table to sit down at, otherwise it's bar space. The space is small, clean, comfortable, newly outfitted and it feels intimate.At 10pm on a Friday it felt awesomely lazy and not obnoxious. It's a simple menu with burgers and sandwiches and a few predictable sides. I was fairly disappointed in this place. Like someone mentioned in another review, the Instagram photos look a lot better than the real thing. I came here with a friend a couple of weeks ago for the first time and I was hoping to be amazed. I ordered the country fried chicken sandwich and she ordered the mushroom burger and overall, it was mediocre at best. The chicken was extremely dry and rather hard and it didn't really have that much flavor going on and my friend, who's never had mushrooms, before concluded that she doesn't really care for them . The fries were pretty good, but not mind blowing. And I also had the mac & cheese jalapeo poppers, which were pretty good but they could've been better. There must be a secret menu or something because I feel like I don't see half of the stuff I see from images listed on their menu. Anyway if I come back here, hopefully on a good day, I'll try a burger instead...maybe that won't be as disappointing. The guy who was working that day was nice though. R. can take the heat, so I am getting in the kitchen...the L.E.S. KitchenL.E.S. Kitchen earned a lot of attention for its over-the-top burger & tots or fries. However I am making room for mushrooms...the "Panko Portobello!" This veggie sandwich is perfecto in my opinion. Fried golden-brown portobello mushroom--topped with slaw, pickles, melted provolone cheese, and a spicy sauce. The PAN/KO's crunchiness will knock you out with savoriness. The slaw has that natural flavor and acidic bite. The cheese adds the right kind of meaty smoothness. And the house sauce has a nice kick to it without overpowering. The rest of the sandwich. The soft bun holds it all together without falling apart. I paired off my shroom sando with Mac & Cheese Jalapeo Poppers. The poppers are essentially fried  Mac & Cheese balls that come with a slightly spicy sauce. The fried Mac & Cheese is pretty amazing. Good crunch. Creamy cheesy macaroni. And a a sauce with a little bit of heat. I'd highly recommend you order these to share if you have friends or savage them solo bc you're probably a serial killer. LolPRO TIP: I would recommend visiting on weekdays. Waits on weekends can be cray especially during brunch-ish hours. Weekends are fine just be prepared to do some waiting. The space is pretty small. There is the bar counter that surrounds the cashier/order taker. There are a couple of tables in the front window. The place might seat about 8-12 total. Turnover is fast bc people tend not to linger. Beverage options here are soft as in soft drinks! Lol. Pairing your burger with a Coke is a good idea. Unless you're one of those weirdos who drinks Pepsi. The staff is youngish. Friendly/ish. Definitely worth a visit if you like enjoy deliciously fried comfort food with creative fixings. drops mic cuz this food needs to mover faster into my mouthI out!zzz Very tiny spot but the staff is very welcoming. The burger was amazing and enormous. Will be back when I'm in the city again. I don't know what happened! I've had this place on my radar for a bit, the reviews are great, but the food I received was really disappointing. Now I will say, we came in late on a Sunday. But they were open, and it IS drunk food in the LES. Given all that, it was a bit odd to discover they had run out of bacon. Bacon is a listed ingredient on a LOT of their food, bacon burgers, fries, tots...but fine. They were also out of the Power Pig, something about pig products I guess.I went with a Truffle Shuffle: a cheeseburger with grilled portobello, caramalized onion, provolone, and house sauce. The burger was way overcooked, low on mushrooms, and the onions were raw!! Caramelized onions make even the most mediocre burger good, so that was just another let down.We also got their Angry Bird sandwich and this was another miss. Stringy, tough, with just a little bit of slaw.The tots were solid. Came here on a rainy Friday night with the hangry beau to grab something quick. He got the Essex Street burger ($12), which comes with crumbled tots (ingenious idea!), thin sliced ribeye and cheddar sauce. We got that with a side of fries ($4) and mac and cheese jalapeo poppers ($4.50). First off, the burger was huge, hearty and delicious. It was big enough for us to split since we got two sides with it. A bit messy to eat with the juices and sauces oozing out with each bite but it's a burger and that's how it should be done. I also liked how the fries were cut and they give you a small plastic dish to put as much ketchup as you want. No need to go back and forth asking for more ketchup (: The mac and cheese jalapeo poppers were bomb. I kinda wish it was spicier but all was well. I think we dipped everything we ordered in ketchup and their house sauce, which btw is crack. We asked for more of their house sauce cause one was obviously not enough.I can easily see this place getting packed during its peak hours. It's a small space with one table big enough to seat 4 at max and stools lined up facing the kitchen area. We lucked out and came on a super rainy day so there was no line or wait. The food also came out pretty fast, brownie points for that since we were kinda tight on time.Overall, it's a cute spot to grab a bombass burger. Don't bring too many people with you since the space isn't meant for large crowds. Also, don't loiter around after your meal cause like I said, it's a small space and other people might be waiting for a seat. There was a group of three teenagers hanging out, being loud and obnoxious on the stool area even after their meal was over, which annoyed the crap out of me since everyone is in close proximity and I just wanted to enjoy my meal in peace. Nonetheless, I'm intrigued by their menu and will go back to try their kitchen sink ($12) with another type of burger next time. Enjoyed this tiny burger joint on the Lower East Side. Most people were getting take out but we grabbed two seats at the bar counter and ordered a whole lot of greasy, fried food.I will start by saying that the sides were really awesome! The tater tots...perfectly crisp on the outside and mushy inside. The mac and cheese balls were also damn good. Who doesn't want fried Mac and cheese?I didn't think my burger was as amazing as the sides, though, to be honest. It was a really good burger. But just nothing special! I ordered the Juicy Lucy which is supposed to be a patty filled with oozing cheese. I could see the cheese but couldn't taste it at all. I think the fried and caramelized onions overpowered all other tastes. Also, I had ordered my burger medium rare and it was most definitely served well done. All in all, good for a quick stop but nothing mind blowing. The food is very good. You get a lot more for what you pay for.We ordered the LES burger, fries and the macaroni and cheese tots. All three were delicious, especially the cheese tots. The spot has seating for about 15-people. It's a nice little cozy spot. I'd definitely recommend. Super friendly staff. I live right above the store and sometimes I  get lazy and they're are always so nice about bringing the food to me. They renovated the space and now they can fit more humans. I love the set up.

If you love Beef Jerky like me, then this is the spot in NYC!  Their Jerky are made fresh, so you better get their early before they are sold out on some of their different variety of Jerky flavor.  I got there around 4ish and they were sold out on some of the jerky.  The lady let us try a sample of a few items and they were delicious.  I ended up getting the spicy beef jerky and it was perfect and tender not as hard as packaged jerky!  I ended up bringing it back home with me and it still tasted fine after 2 days of not eating the jerky.  Next time when I am in NYC again I am defiantly getting more to bring home to share with family and friends!! You know I'm such a fool for jerkyGot jerky wrapped around your finger ahhahhDo you have to let it Ling Kee?Do you have to?Do you have to?Do you have to let it Ling Kee?I was sent here by my good friend Yael, and she wasn't wrong. They had some of the most interesting and unusual tasting Jerkys that I've ever had.
